85502.name: Battleships Forever

videogamehonor.32177: 2008 IGF Awards Excellence in Design Nominee

85502.description:
Battleships Forever is a freeware tactical Real Time Strategy game that put's you in command of a small fleet of warships in space. Combat and damage mechanics are extremely detailed. Everything is simulated in game if possible. There are no abitrary "to hit chance" values in Battleships Forever. The game also features many innovative mechanics that you've never seen before. For example, the Cronus Battleship sports a Flux Shield generator that allows you to draw a defensive force shield around your ships in any shape you want. Another example are the Deflector modules that are used extensively through the game. These modules make a single section of a ship totally invulnerable to fire. This means that you will have to manoeuvre your ships to attack sections of the enemy ships not protected by Deflectors while keeping your own protected sections facing the enemy. Position is paramount!

Players will command picked fleets made up of Battleships, Destroyers and Patrol Craft. The completed game will include ten campaign missions and multiple skirmish modes.

Battleships Forever is inspired by and loosely based on Warning Forever by Hikoza.T.Ohkubo

Source: The Developer's Website.


Redeveloped from: Warning Forever

85503.name: The Eye of Judgment: Legends
85503.description:
User Summary

The Eye of Judgment: Legends is a PSP spinoff of the PS3 game The Eye of Judgment. At its core, Legends is a turn based card battle game but, unlike its PS3 relative, Legends does not make use of physical cards and does not need any physical peripherals. The game has the player travel a fantasy world defeating other characters in card battles. As the player progresses they improve their deck with more powerful cards and special powers. Legends includes more than 30 additions to the Eye of Judgment card deck, and some cards have been rebalanced.

85504.name: Don't Let the Pigeon Drive the Bus Game!
85504.description:
From the box back:

Uh-oh! The Pigeon wants to drive YOUR bus and it's up to you to stop him!

Move you bus around the board, using simple strategy to keep the Pigeon from driving it. But drive carefully - if the Pigeon lands on the same space as your bus, you must go back to Start and try again.

Children develop their concentration, strategy and fine motor skills in this action-packed game.

85505.name: Deception at Dasa
85505.description:
From the back of the box:

The Wheatlands District is home to the most fertile expanse of prairie grassland in Calandia. Deception at Dasa, a comprehensive adventure guidebook set, brings to life this illustrious fantasy setting in the City-State of the Invincible Overlord.
This two volume set includes The Wheatlands Guidebook, a reference book detailing this district of the City-State, and Deception at Dasa, an adventure set in the district. Also included are a Players' map and a full-color Game Master's map of the area, presenting this rich setting in complete detail.
The Wheatlands Guidebook provides exciting material for your current fantasy role-playing campaign, or you may use this volume to create an infinite variety of new adventures and campaigns.
In the adventure Deception at Dasa, you are elite scouts in the Overlord's army and are instrumental in the Overlord's effort to overcome the evil spreading through western Calandia. Within the confines of the decadent, depraved city of Dasa, Galathrien, the mastermind of theis evil, basks in the adoration of devoted followers.
But the road in treacherous.
Ohter scouts have gone to face Galathrien before you - never to return.
Now, you must take on the challenge and enter the magically protected city and defeat him - pr her...
Deception at Dasa in designed for play by 5-6 Player Characters of Skill levels 5 to 6. Six pregenerated Characters of various races and Character classes are provided with this adventure, or you may generate your own.

85506.name: Xabungle the Walker Machine
85506.description:
This game represent land-ship voyage in the science fiction animate cartoon series 'Xabungle'.
This game was designed for the beginner.

Each player goes to the destination by his land-ship. It gets the blue-stones during the voyage by the battle and the trade. Also get the blue-stones by arriving at the destination early. The player who got most minerals does a victory.

A rule is divided into two steps of the basic game and the advanced game, and it uses a different game board.

A basic game proceeds through the straight road decided by a course, and does a battle in accordance with the indication of map.

A hex map with the geographical features is used with an advanced game. It can trade and refueling by the specific terrain. It becomes a battle when it approaches the ship of other players.

A battle is resolved by the card play in both rules.
There are the Walker machine cards, a pilot card and a weapon card in the card. A six side die is used with the total strength of each cards and the combat result table, and a battle is resolved.

85508.name: Briarwood Castle
85508.description:
From the back of the box:

In the heart of the City-State of Brairwood, capital of Calandia, lie the confines of Briarwood Castle. Home to the Invincible Overlord, the Castle's interior has always been a mystery to outsiders. Now you can be privy to the closely-guarded secrets of Briarwood Castle in this two volume set, which includes The Briarwood Castle Guidebook and The Dungeon Book, plus a seperate parchment GM's map depecting the dungeon controlled by Ralf, a lich whose quest for power could have a profound impact on the City-State. This set provides exciting material for endless variety of fantasy roe-playing scenarios.
In the adventure you are convicted criminals of the City-State. The Overlord himself has offered to save you from the Death penalty if you can find the vulnerabilities in the Castle's defenses and enter the Castle from the outside of its walls
Someone close to Lucius II is betraying him, and that person dules over the depths of The Old Bathhouse Dungeon and Ralf's Dungeon. These dungeons hold a legacy of evil, and death awaits those who venture here!
The adventure is for 4-6 Player Characters of Skill Levels 20+. Six evil pregenerated Player Characters are provided for this adventure, or Players may generate thier own. The Special Dungeons may be used either with the adventure in this set, or in an existing adventure os campaign.

videogame.101637: BS Fire Emblem Akaneia Senki 1: Palace Kanraku

85509.name: Fire Emblem: Hero of Light and Shadow
85509.description:
User Summary

Fire Emblem: Hero of Light and Shadow is a remake of half of the classic Super Nintendo game Fire Emblem: Monshō no Nazo. The remake is of Book 2 of the original game. The game stars Marth in the War of Heroes. The player takes the role of Marth’s close ally known as the “Hero of Shadow”, although they control all characters on the field that are in their force. The game plays similarly to other recent Fire Emblem titles, with the player choosing the actions of each unit on their turn. Light and Shadow includes four difficulty levels as well as a Casual Mode that makes unit deaths non-permanent in the campaign. The standard mode is still available for players (death is permanent for units).

The game also includes the orginal four part BS Fire Emblem Akaneia Senki Super Famicom Sattelaview series in the Extras.

85510.description:
Elves & Shelves is a free, print-and-play auction game for 2 to 4 players. Thematically it follows on from Warehouse Elves, with which it shares some components.

The toys have been brought in from the warehouse and placed on the sorting shelves. Your job as the sorting elves is to collect them according to the children’s Wishlists.

The game is played over 3 rounds of single-card blind bidding (tied bids cancel out). At the end of each round, scoring takes place. The player with the highest score after the third round is the winner.

Winner of the 2010 Christmas Print and Play Game Design Contest
85510.name: Elves & Shelves

85511.name: Asgard (Issue 7 - Sep 2002)
85511.description:
Special Swimsuit Edition!

Issue 7 of Asgard Magazine

Cover Art by J. L. Jones

85512.name: All That Glitters
85512.description:
A D20 Guide to Gems and Jewelry. A rules enhancement to expand on gem and jewelry craft.

From the Download Description
All That Glitters is a sourcebook about gems and jewelry. It covers gem-cutting and jewelry-making (with new Craft rules), discusses gemstone value, and adds many new precious metals, enchanted gems, and even a few spells.

85513.description:
This is expansion kit for Kyushu Sangokushi.
"Chinzei Gunki" means "Record of suppress the western region".

Covering battles of the Kyushu conquest by Toyotomi Hideyoshi.

Four scenarios are included in this kit:

"Battle of Hetusigi-gawa" (1 turn)
"Siege of Iwaya castle" (short)
"Battles between Satsuma and Bungo" (short)
"Kanpaku goes west" (short but with a very large army coming from central Japan)
85513.name: Chinzei Gunki

85516.description:
In this variant of Revolution, the player with the most meeples can, in a particular area, use the special ability of the character who is presently there.

Expanded by

6 character pieces
5 markers




Published in Spielbox #5/2010
85516.name: New Characters (Fan Expansion for Revolution)

85517.name: LifeSigns: Surgical Unit
85517.description:
User summary:

In this exciting and dramatic hospital simulation game you play the role of Dokuta Tendo, a 25 year old intern at a prestigious hospital. Although you lack no talent, you are still wet behind your ears. Your everyday hospital routine involves diagnosing patients and performing demanding and realistic operations. An important part of your time is devoted in character interaction where you have to balance your relationships with male and female staff.

A random series of fun mini games, such as fishing, catching snakes or cooking, offer you relief from stress and tension and make your overall satisfaction from the title even more complete.

85518.name: Chronicles of Future Earth
85518.description:
Publisher blurb:

It is the end of the Fifth Cycliad, the unimaginably far future of planet Earth. A world grown strange with time, where the stars are but a distant memory, and demons, sorcery and ancient technologies hold humankind in thrall.

The Venerable Autocracy of Sakara, oldest and greatest of the Springtide Civilizations, is decaying from within. In its vast and crumbling cities strange races eke out lives unchanged for millennia, while ancient enemies gnaw at the edges of the world, ready to wreak a terrible revenge.

In these dark days a cry goes out for heroes, to stand against the dying of the light and save the world from the sins of its past. Sorcerer, priest, warrior or prince, everyone knows the end of an age is at hand.

Will you answer the call?

Welcome to The Chronicles of Future Earth.

The Chronicles of Future Earth is volume one of the new techno-fantasy setting for Chaosium's Basic Roleplaying, and contains: an introduction to Urth, the world of the unimaginably far future, focusing on the vast and ancient city of Korudav; new races, cultures, and occupations; new magic, artifacts, and religions; rules for demons and divine powers; a bestiary of the Urth’s more deadly denizens; and "The Worm Within", an introductory scenario showcasing this unique and adventure-filled world.

85519.name: For Love or Power
85519.description:
From the introduction:
For Love or Power deals with the idea of romance in an RPG and it also looks at the medieval reality of marriage as well. There are certain assumptions already made and they are the following:

1. The campaign has room for it without disrupting everything else. For example, romance will probably not fit into a typical "kick the doors in" campaign where role-playing of any kind is minimized. Other types of campaigns might have good or bad reasons to include romance and there may be better times to include it than others.

2. Every one of the players and the GM has agreed that romance that should be in the game. The maturity level in the group is high enough to accept it without causing the game to break down. The amount of romance can vary in every campaign. Is the main plot, a occasional sub-plot or does it only take place during in between adventures or perhaps only played out when some of the players cannot make it. The agreement is very important because disinterest or distrust can quickly derail the game.

85520.name: Backblast #1
85520.description:
A magazine devoted to the game of Advanced Squad Leader. Included were articles about tactics of the game as well as nine scenarios.

Taming Tulagi features US Marines digging the Japanese out of their caves on Tulagi island in 1942.

Throwing Down the Gauntlet pits a Canadian paratroop company against dug in Germans on D-Day.

Point of the Sword depicts British advanced elements assaulting the Germans in a fortified town on D-Day.

A Desperate Affair has the lightly armed German paratroopers dropping directly on top of British forces on the island of Crete.

Going to Church has been reprinted twice since this magazine was released and has been played more than any other scenario in this product. SS troops have to hold a church against advancing Canadian infantry.

Shattering the Line shows the twilight years of the Third Reich as hopelessly outnumbered German infantry try to stop the Soviet advance outside of Berlin.

The Pinnacle is another cave busting scenario on the island of Ie Shima in 1945. US Army regulars with heavy armored support try to dislodge a well dug in Japanese battalion.

Castello Fatato has the surrounded Italians attacking a small Russian village during the Stalingrad campaign as the Italians attempt to reach friendly lines.

A Wedge in the Ice depicts the Finnish defense of the Mannerheim Line late in the Winter War against a vastly superior Russian assault force.

85522.name: The Big Sleaze
85522.description:
User summary:

In this three part adventure by the unforgettable comic genius Fergus McNeill you play the part of private eye Sam Spillade. Investigative work on your first two cases, will take you on a thoroughly entertaining trip through the sleazy low life of Manhattan in the 1930's.

You will be able to interact with people and objects via means of verb commands and you will also be able to collect and make use of items you find along the way. The five item inventory limit will be a restriction, so you will have to make a good use of your ingenuity and resourcefulness. You will however be very well compensated by the game's neatness and witty humor!

videogame.85525: MegaTraveller 1: The Zhodani Conspiracy + MegaTraveller 2: Quest for the Ancients

85523.name: MegaTraveller 1: The Zhodani Conspiracy

videogamecompilation.85525: MegaTraveller 1: The Zhodani Conspiracy + MegaTraveller 2: Quest for the Ancients

85523.description:
From the back of the box:

The four legendary Frontier Wars have passed, each started by the Zhodani and each ending in a shaky peace....

....Now with the help of corrupt Imperium officials the Zhodani and the Outward Coalition are planning a fifth. Smuggling arms to traitorous groups within Imperium borders, the Zhodani are planning to strike from within.

- Realistic combat sequences let you control each of your characters individually, while still giving general combat orders to the other members of your party. Utilise more than 30 weapons and skills in this advanced combat system.

- 28 planets and satellites to explore in 8 systems filled with exciting puzzles, dangerous subplots and interesting characters to encounter.

- 72 varied skills to learn and use including medical, piloting, communications, laser weapons, bribery, demolitions and handgun.

- Flexible gaming system supports any playing strategy and allows multiple solutions to problems and obstacles.

videogame.85525: MegaTraveller 1: The Zhodani Conspiracy + MegaTraveller 2: Quest for the Ancients

85524.name: MegaTraveller 2: Quest for the Ancients

videogamecompilation.85525: MegaTraveller 1: The Zhodani Conspiracy + MegaTraveller 2: Quest for the Ancients

85524.description:
From the back of the box:

Vacations never last long for Travellers - we should have known that. Yet here we are on a desperate mission to save a planet from impending doom, battling an armed corsair full of intergalactic pirates.

Plasma blasts are rocking the hull. Jurgen is evading the barrage as best he can, but we're badly outclassed. Their meson screens are strong and tight, and Dennar is still repairing the jump drive. Effane is manning one of the beam laser turrets, trying to keep pace with our newest team member, a retired Vargr soldier, who despite the canine features, shoots as well as she.

Me? I'm trying to stay calm and think of a way out of this - fast. A mysterious artifact reportedly built by a quasi-mythical race of early starfarers known as the Ancients, has suddenly come to life on the subsector capital of Rhylanor. Now the entire planet faces imminent destruction unless we act in time. The only hope seems to be learning the secrets of the Ancients - which won't be an easy task.

The Ancients were destroyed 300,000 years ago.

85525.name: MegaTraveller 1: The Zhodani Conspiracy + MegaTraveller 2: Quest for the Ancients
85525.description:
User Summary

A compilation boxset of the two MegaTraveller games.

85526.name: MacArthur's War: Battles for Korea, June 1950 - April 1951
85526.description:
From the back of the game folder:

Across the 38th parallel...

In June of 1950, the North Korean People's Army struck suddenly at the Republic of Korea with the intention of re-uniting the Korean Peninsula under one government. After dramatic initial successes, the North Korean forces were poised to complete their triumph with the capture of the last bastion, Pusan.

United Nations forces, spear-headed by America, rushed to the scene and in deperate fighting stalled the NKPA. The tide turned. MacArthur's brilliant capture of Seoul cut the NKPA forces from the supplies and within a month the North Koreans had been routed back to the 38th parallel. UN troops pursued the foe, notwithstanding the danger of Chinese and/or Russian intervention.

The tide turned again. The valour of the Chinese Army surprised everyone. UN forces were pushed back to the 38th parallel once more before a strong defensive line was established.

MacArthur's War recreates the great battles of the war. You can command either United Nations or Communist forces against human or computer opponents in the battles of...

'Across the 38th' Taejon Naktong Bulge Unsan
Chongchon Chosin Reservoir Chipyong Imjin

The Battlefront Game System mechanics are so simple to use, you will be issuing orders like a veteran within ten minutes of assuming command.

You'll have complete control over the computer battlefield when you use the comprehensive wargame construction set, WarPlan, and our unique graphics editor, WarPaint.

85527.name: Sanada Gunki
85527.description:
This game is operational level wargame for siege of Osaka．
Each player control either Osaka side (aka Toyotomi Army) or Kanto side (aka Tokugawa Army).
NB: A "gunki" is a war story or record (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gunki_monogatari).
"Sanada Gunki" can be translated by "Record of Sanada Yukimura (most famous commander in this campaign) and his troop".

Each troop organized by one or more unit.
The game repeats the game turn decided by the scenario. Each game turn divided for two player turn. Each player turn include Movement phase, none active side reaction movement phase, Force march phase and combat phase. All unit can move in movement phase, but required pass activity check in reaction and force march phase. Combat result by fire power CRT and two dice.

Victor of the games is decide by victory points. The victory point is provided by the capture of the castle, the removal of the enemy units and unit in the enter important city or province.

The game contain Winter campaign scenario and Summer campaign scenario with three fictional variant.

GAME SCALE : Each hex of map is roughly 5000 meters. Each game turn represents three days of real time. Each combat units represents about 2500 soldiers.

85529.name: Die ägyptische Pyramide
85529.description:
Players try to form the longest possible continuous rows of balls. Winner is the one scoring most points.

In his turn player places one ball of his color on a 6x6 grid (36 recessed spaces on the board). The other players place their balls, turn by turn. The aim is to form continuous rows of one color, running horizontally, vertically or diagonally, until the first layer of the pyramid is complete. Once a floor is finished, the players count their points. Each layer is scored separately. Each alignment scores the number of balls that it has. Some balls scores several times if they are at the crossroads of several alignments.

On each floor, the plateau decreases a little more.

When the pyramid is completed, the players count the lines that appear on the slopes of the pyramid.

For two players, there are two options: Either everyone plays two colors, or players build a smaller pyramid.

85530.name: Outlaws: Adventures in the Old West
85530.description:
'The year is 1876. The small town of Deadrock is almost deserted; anyone with any sense had already left town. Only Sheriff Jim Murray and his deputies Samuel and Dale remain. Incarcerated in the town's jail is one of the Carson Gang, Luke Young.

Jim watches as a cloud of dust approaches from the west. He knows it is the Carson Gang coming to get Luke. He picks up his trusty Winchester '73, barks a few instructions to Samuel and Dale, wearily walks to the window of his office and waits.....'

Will Jim and his deputies see off the gang long enough for Marshall Samson and his men to arrive? Or will Jesse spring Luke in time and make their escape? Both men's fates are in your hands...

Outlaws is a free Print & Play fast playing game of gunfights, bank heists and general shenanigans set in the Old West of America. Each character in the game has his own character card with which a player tracks what he holds and carries and any wounds he picks up.

The game can be played in two modes: stand alone scenarios called shootouts, and adventures where several scenarios are linked together into a larger storyline.

The game system is based around an action track system where characters expend actions to perform activities. Wounds are represented by randomly drawn wound counters that may result in anything from a small leg graze to a belly wound that will get worse during the course of the game to a direct head shot that takes out a man immediately.

The initial release of the game is titled; Outlaws: Adventures in the Old West - Episode One. Each episode will include the base rules which run to 12 pages and include many illustrations on all aspects of play. There is also a Shootout and Adventure booklet containing scenarios.

In Episode One there are 10 maps - each will print on a single US Letter or A4 page and will tile with each other to create a large range of environments in which scenarios are set. Episode one contains all you need to play.

85531.name: Empire Deluxe Masters Edition
85531.description:
User Summary:

A compilation of Empire Deluxe DOS, Empire Deluxe Windows and Empire Deluxe Scenarios, on CD-ROM.

85532.name: Knowledge Arcana (Issue 2 - Summer 2004)
85532.description:
Issue 2 of Knowledge Arcana

Cover art by Heather C. Keiser

Includes a word search puzzle by Wizo_Gaelin and a 'Snatching Victory from the Jaws of Defeat' Magic: the Gathering puzzle.

85533.name: Captures
85533.description:
In Captures, each player has three leopards (the targets) and a cube (the hunter) with one side open. Your goal is to capture as many of your opponent's leopards as possible while being the last player to have at least one leopard in the wild.

On your turn, you move your hunter cube to try to catch an opponent's leopard. You catch a leopard when your hunter is on the path of an opponent's cube and the leopard is in its open side.

In the end, players tally their points — 1 point for each captured leopard and 6 points for each leopard still free — and the player with the highest sum wins.

85534.name: Jackie Chan's Action Kung Fu
85534.description:
Jackie Chan's Action Kung Fu is an action platform video game produced by Hudson Soft. It was first released for the Nintendo Entertainment System in 1990 and for the TurboGrafx-16 in 1991.

The plot revolves around Jackie Chan with his sister Josephine being supreme kung fu champs, guarding the country against evil until the Prince of Sorcerers, a green-skinned villain with magical powers attacks Jackie and kidnaps his sister. Jackie embarks on an adventure to stop the Prince of Sorcerers and his minions and save his sister.

Gameplay

The player controls Jackie Chan, the well-known martial arts stunt master, and brawls against many enemies during his quest to save his sister. The game is played through five levels (each with a boss at the end).

Throughout the game, The player would encounter frogs that carry power-ups or bowls, (which are items in the game that restore health), but the frogs would have to be hit in order for the item to be obtained. Power-ups can allow the player to do a special type of attack over a limited amount of times (although the player is only able to carry one power-up). The player is also able to charge a special beam-like attack, although it can only be used up to five times. Most of the enemies that the player defeats will drop green orbs. If the player collects 30 orbs, life will be replenished (as well as the 5 charged shots).

If the player dies, all of the orbs and power-ups are lost and must be gained again. The player only has 1 life in the game, but may continue up to five times initially. Extra continues may be earned through the bonus stages throughout the game, which are levels triggered by bells in the levels which transport Jackie to the bonus stages, each of which have a 30-second time limit and usually involve jumping on clouds or hitting statues to earn points. At the end of 30 seconds, those points are tallied and may also be used to buy extra lives and special attacks.

Version Differences

In NES version, collecting 30 orbs will replenish health and charged shots. In TurboGrafx-16 version, 100 orbs are needed.

In TurboGrafx-16 version, some enemies don't drop orbs at all while other enemies drop one to several orbs, when killed.

In TurboGrafx-16 version, there are more enemies and many enemies take more hits to kill than in NES version.

The TurboGrafx-16 version has 2 extra mid-bosses who appear at 4th and 5th stage.

There are major differences in level layout and boss behavior between the two versions.

Many of the enemies and their attacks are different.

Source: Wikipedia, "Jackie Chan's Action Kung Fu", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

85535.name: DJ MAX Portable Black Square
85535.description:
DJ Max Portable Black Square (Korean: 디제이맥스 포터블 블랙 스퀘어, DMP BS) is a music game for the PlayStation Portable developed by South Korean developer Pentavision released on December 24, 2008. This is the third major game of the DJMAX series released for the PSP. The game includes various enhancements and new features built on from DJ Max Portable 2 and DJ Max Portable Clazziquai Edition. The original aim was to launch the game in November, however due to numerous bugs found in DJ Max Portable Clazziquai Edition, the release of DJ Max Portable Black Square was postponed.

Source: Wikipedia, "DJ Max Portable Black Square," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

85536.name: Stack-Up

videogamefranchise.28200: NES Black Box (1980s NES Games, US)

85536.description:
Stack-Up (AKA Robot Block) is a video game released in 1985 for the Nintendo Entertainment System, designed for use with R.O.B. the Robotic Operating Buddy. Stack-Up is one of two games in Nintendo's Robot Series, the other being Gyromite (AKA Robot Gyro). While Gyromite was a pack-in game with the R.O.B. itself and therefore came with all the parts needed to play the game, Stack-Up came in a large box containing additional bases and colored discs. Because it was marketed to children and the set came with many small, plastic parts, complete copies of the game are very hard to come by. All Stack-Up cartridges contain the 60-pin circuit board from the Famicom version attached to a 72-pin adapter like the T89 Cartridge Converter for the NES. This is one of the rarest first-party games for the NES.

Plot

In some modes, Professor Hector works with R.O.B. to organize blocks. In others, Hector competes for control of R.O.B. against "glitches" named Spike & Flipper, or against Professor Vector.

Gameplay

The player must direct Professor Hector to jump onto buttons, that each activate an action for R.O.B., in a sequence in order to get R.O.B. to arrange the colored discs in a certain order on the five pedestals around R.O.B.

Different Modes of Play
Bingo (1P): Like the other single-player modes, the player progresses through phases by moving the blocks from one arrangement to another, but in this mode block colors are irrelevant, and the difficulty is derived from the method used to control R.O.B. The screen is occupied by a 5x5 bingo board that Professor Hector hops around on. Rows on the bingo board correspond to R.O.B. commands: and when a row is completed, the command is executed. The computer-controlled enemies Spike and Flipper roam about, and touching either one will send Professor Hector flying back to the starting position. Spike wanders randomly, but Flipper moves in straight lines from one side of a row to another, activating and deactivating spaces wherever he lands, potentially sending undesired commands to R.O.B. The game ends when a block is dropped.

Bingo (2P): In this mode, only Professors Hector and Vector occupy the bingo board, competing to send commands to R.O.B., with the goal in mind that player 1 wants more blocks to R.O.B.'s left, and player 2 wants more blocks to R.O.B.'s right. The game begins with three blocks in the middle, and one block to either side.

Test: This mode sends a signal to R.O.B. that causes his LED to light up, confirming that he can receive signals from the television.

Direct: The player begins by arranging the blocks in a standard starting pattern (red, white, blue, yellow and green top-to-bottom on tray #3), and is given a randomly chosen pattern they should be rearranged into by entering commands for R.O.B. one at a time. Once the goal is achieved, the player must press start to inform the game. Score is then calculated based on the time and number of moves taken, and the game moves onto the next phase, for which the starting point is the previous phase's ending position. Phases grow increasingly complicated to execute as the player progresses. Play continues until a block is dropped. The score at that time is the final score, and the player must return to the menu screen by pressing select.

Memory: Like Direct mode, except that rather than entering commands one at a time, the entire sequence of commands must be programmed in advance. R.O.B. goes through the program all at once. Once the sequence has run its course, the player presses start to move on to the next phase or select to return to the main menu. Scoring is the same as in direct mode, with the time score derived from the time taken to enter the commands, not the time taken to execute the program.

Source: Wikipedia, "Stack Up", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

85537.name: The Day of Deeds
85537.description:
Publisher Blurb:
A city like any other, a day like any other, except. At eleven fifty nine PM people vanished. Not Joe from the news stand or Jane from the coffee shop, no those who are gone are those who hold our city together. All the heroes but you, are gone, most of the police and firemen also have vanished. Can you hold the city together, are you up to the challenge of "The day of deeds?"

In the adventure "The day of deeds" We offer the GM the ability to put heroes through the paces, in a city enveloped in chaos with little or no backup. This adventure uses a random system to ensure a new experience each time it is played. It is made for any size or power level group, and can be played multiple times with out repetition. This adventure will easily fit into any city campaign and can be run with little to no preparation.

85538.name: Master of the Game
85538.description:
From the back cover:

It is said that a role-playing game is only as good as its Game Master. Now there is a book especially designed and dedicated to this principal performer. Expertly written by renowned Grand Master Gary Gygax, Master of the Game guides Game Masters of all role-playing games in how to achieve their highest degree of proficiency and skill. It then stimulates them even further to excellence beyond their campaign, if it's so desired. Here's the complete Game Master experience, including chapters on:

- Preparing for the Principal Role
- The Master Milieu: Design and Maintenance
- Mastery and Modification of the Rules and Systems
- How to Master the Adventure Scenario
- Why a Campaign Fails
- How to Establish and Manage an RPG Convention
- How to Create Your Own RPG Publication
- How to Assist Others toward Master Game Mastering

For present and aspiring Game Masters, Master of the Game is the long-awaited companion to Gary Gygax's previous successful book, Role Playing Mastery. It's a guide no Game Master should be without.

85539.description:
A tactical expansion to En Pointe Toujours !, game system originally published (in French) in Vae Victis magazine issue 16.

This game, is a campaign during the long siege of Dien Bien Phu, during 5 nights, 1st to 6th April 1954.

Fighting for the ancient "Anne-Marie 3", north to the vital runway, the French forces (I/2REI, III/13 DBLE and II/1 RCP) French Foreign Legion and Paratroopers, must hold the strongpoint, Huguette 6, night after night, against the Viet-Minh forces humans waves and artillery support.

New counters and rules.
A4 map.
85539.name: En Pointe Toujours!: Combats pour Huguette 6

85540.name: Fantasy Role Playing Games
85540.description:
From front flap:

Here is an illustrated introduction to the intellectual pastime that has become almost a way of life for an astonishing number of participants - fantasy role playing games of the Dungeons and Dragons type. The book describes the development of these addictive games from their origins in the early 70's, and presents a state-of-the-art summary of their variations, their physical paraphernalia, their statistical tools and props, and the special imaginative atmosphere that each is likely to develop.
Less abstract than cards or chess, the fantasy role playing games have a large element of genuinely social inprovisation. Given a world and characters defined in ways that more or less directly reflect our values and assumptions, the drama that is developed by the participants in each such game is likely to have surprising relevance to life in the last quarter of the 20th Century - despite the deliberate invocation of times past and future, and of locates highly elaborated to the grotesque.

85541.name: Robin of Sherlock
85541.description:
User summary:

Relive the spirit of Sherwood through the eyes of Robin H.... hmm... no...!

Experience the brilliant reasoning of cunning detective Sherlock H... er... that's not right either...!

Actually... it is Robin of Sherlock!! Explore the best of both worlds in this hilarious parody adventure, where the world-famous "outlaw" and the equally famous detective get on famously with each other by merging into a single entity, presenting you with loads of fun and surreal humor!

85542.name: The Dungeon Master
85542.description:
From the Front Flap:

When James Dallas Egbert III disappeared from the Michigan State University campus in 1979, he was no ordinary college dropout. Egbert was a computer genius at sixteen, a boy with an I.Q. of 180-plus and an extravagant imagination. He was a fanatic Dungeons & Dragons player - before the game was widely known - and he and his friends played a live version in a weird labyrinth of tunnels and rooms beneath the university. These secret passages even ran within the walls of buildings themselves. After Egbert disappeared, there were rumors of witch cults, drug rings, and homosexuality to try to explain the mystery.

85543.name: Inner Darkness 2: The Depravity War
85543.description:
From the back of the book.


Let There Be War

As heroes go on adventures and defeat villains, they gain wisdom, experience, and power. They develop new abilities, increase their skill levels, and gain the ability to take on greater challenges.

People tend to forget that villains can improve, too.

This is what happens when villains learn from their mistakes and strive to improve themselves - when a seminal bad guy upgrades and makes a real menace out of themselves.

Villains from the original Inner Darkness and the supplements Yiffy, Yaoi, and Yahooey! and the Breeding Time are presented here - upgraded to the next level and waging war on the world, and each other.

If someone doesn’t stop them, the Shadow War comes out into the open, the Earth perishes from a spiritual and physical cancer, and humanity is finished. No matter what happens, the world of Hot Chicks will never be the same again.


This book contains adult content - strong language, nudity, sexual situations, and adult themes. Reader discretion is advised.

85544.name: Mouse Guard Roleplaying Game Box Set

rpghonor.16617: 2011 Golden Geek Best RPG Artwork/Presentation Winner

85544.description:
User Summary Based on Designer's Blog:

A complete game play boxed set based upon the award winning role playing game originally released in hardcover format.

Planned items for in the box include: a softcover edition of the 320-page Mouse Guard Roleplaying Game, a pad of character sheets, a pad of GM sheets, a folding GM screen with handy reference charts, a map of the territories, 5 mouse pawns (which I carved the master for) to mark locations on the map, a 44 page rules, missions and adventures supplement, 10 custom Mouse Guard dice, and 72 cards to help streamline play.

The 44 page rules supplement is also planned for pdf publication so that current game owners can access the new rules.

In 2015 Mouse Guard Roleplaying Game Boxed Set (Second Edition) was published.

85545.name: Little Magics
85545.description:
From the back of the book.


LITTLE MAGICS

Not all spells are huge, flashy displays of magical might to lay low whole squads of your foes. Some magic is "little..." tiny spells for making the life of the mage easier, easing discomforts and performing simple tasks.

Small spells are Cantrips, and here you will find a fine selection of them; 21 in all. Everything from making food taste better to storing small items and creating small but shiny displays of magical light.

Also inside, find some notes on using Cantrips in your Hot Chicks campaigns, a little history of their use, and the statistics of an up and coming young Daughter of Wickedness who has to master the little magics before she can move on to the big ones...

For use with Hot Chicks: The Roleplaying Game. It never hurts to have a little magic on your side, and magic doesn’t come much smaller than this!


This book contains mature content - strong language and mature themes. Reader discretion is advised.

85546.name: Seven Kingdoms: Ancient Adversaries
85546.description:
User summary:

Seven Kingdoms: Ancient Adversaries is an updated and re-released version of Seven Kingdoms. You get to lead one of seven civilizations to greatness by means of trade, diplomacy, intelligence, cunning and of course brute force.

You get to gather resources, collect taxes, build a formidable army, exploit your own strengths and your enemies' weaknesses and compete for world domination.

85547.name: Victims and Bystanders
85547.description:
From the back of the book.


Victims All!

To be a proper hero or a proper villain, there needs to be a victim involved. Someone to imperil, someone to save, someone to add dialogue that makes it all seem more impressive.

Here are two dozen NPCs to sprinkle into your Hot Chicks campaign to make your villainy more villainous, and your heroism more heroic. They span the spectrum from useless to competent, from street scum to the ivory towers. Whatever your victim needs, you’ll find what you’re looking for here.

Also presented are ideas for taking our lower-than-starting-PC-level characters and running a down-and-dirty game, for tension, story line, and laughs.

This supplement for Hot Chicks: The Roleplaying Game will add personality and variety to any of our other supplements. In the war for the future and destiny of mankind, these people here are the contested territory.

Save them, if you can!


This book contains mature content - strong language and mature themes. Reader discretion is advised.

85548.name: Daddy Long Legs
85548.description: Flick the colored spinner and pivot either leg of your Daddy Long Legs to the appropriate color. You may be able to move forward but you might have to move backwards! First player to reach the finish line wins!

85549.description: From the back of the book: BattleTech Record Sheets 3025 & 3026 provides more than 200 filled-out record sheets for the Battlemechs, tanks, hovercraft, and VTOL's described in Battletech Technical Readouts 3025 and 3026, including major variants and alternate configurations. As an added feature, the game information for weapons and equipment appears on each sheet for easy reference.
85549.name: Battletech Record Sheets: 3025 & 3026

85552.name: Knowledge Arcana (Issue 3 - Fall 2004)
85552.description:
Issue 3 of Knowledge Arcana

Cover by Heather C Keiser

With a crossword puzzle by Orion Cooper and Snatching Victory from the Jaws of Defeat a Magic: the Gathering puzzle by Carol Ellzey (Squee's Main Squeeze)

85553.name: The Gary's Game
85553.description:
From the rules

Welcome to the world of Gary's Games and Hobbies -- in a card game!

Ever wondered what kind of people hang out at a game store and play games? Have you ever thought about what that might be like?

Well wonder no more! The Gary's Game will let you experience the excitement and drama from your own home with your own friends.

User Summary

Climbing game, similar to The Great Dalmuti or Pyramid Card or Scum: The Food Chain Game or Deathtrap Dungeon: Card Game or Dilbert: Corporate Shuffle or ... Players try to get rid of their cards as fast as possible. The first person to get rid of their cards becomes Head of the Line in the next hand. Differences include two wild cards, which can be paired with any card, or if both in one hand, can used before the game begins to reorder the table completely.

The card themes are based on the staff and customers of Gary's Games and Hobbies in Seattle, WA. The game was released to celebrate the store's twentieth anniversary in October of 2010.

85554.name: Swords of Destiny
85554.description:
From back of box:

Face your destiny!

An evil force threatens the nation with legions of demonic hordes. Take the role of a supremely talented apprentice and slay the demon menace with the magical swords of Yi, or those of your deefated opponents!

- A graphically outstanding ancient chinese setting
- Learn the secrets of the Sword Time combos
- Create yor own swords from the fallen foes weapons

85555.name: Neutral Zone:  A Game of Interstellar Expansion
85555.description:
From the Designer....
Neutral Zone is a game of interstellar expansion that can be played by 2 to 6 people. The setting of the game is a spherical volume of space and the 61 stars, including Sol, that occupy this volume. In the game of Neutral Zone, six galactic powers compete for control of this area of space, and seek to dominate all of the stars within it.
Neutral Zone is a game where 6 alien empires trade, fight, and negotiate over resources and real-estate. Six sets of plastic playing pieces representing Space and Planetary [Ground] Forces are used. Planets are randomly drawn and placed on each star. The planets determine what resources and events occur to all players.

85556.name: Carolus. Great Northern War
85556.description:
Designer summary: Carolus. Great Northern War is a Card Driven game focusing on the events of the war between Sweden, led by young king Karl XII and coalition of her enemies: Russia (led by Pyotr, later known as Peter the Great) Saxony (led by Augustus der Starke - the Strong) and Denmark (led by Frederik IVth). The war has also spread to initially neutral Poland, which became a battleground for involved powers.

In history, the Coalition has lost three major battles in the first year of the war. But the war continued, even despite early Danish withdrawal and Saxon surrender, which followed six years later. Carolus, who was also able to put his own king on Polish throne in the meantime, faced his last active enemy - Russia. His failed attempt at taking Moscow became the pivotal event and a milestone in Northern European history.

Players will be able to recreate those events or find their own alternative strategies to win the Great Northern War themselves.

The game is currently in development, first bits will be hopefully shown at Essen Spiel 2010.

85557.description:
Legend has it that once every hundred years a dragon descends from the sky and bestows a large fortune upon the magician who has the best control of the elements. It has been a hundred years since the last contest and mages from all over the land have gathered in anticipation. In spite of being a young mage you have proven your mettle by outlasting all but six other mages. Suddenly the skies are lit by a blinding light and out of the sky emerges the most magnificent of all creatures. The Dragon has arrived and perched on Mount Fuji, the legend is true! Your resolve has redoubled; the time to make your mark on the world and gain a fantastic fortune is close.

Can you keep your focus and control the elements to win?

Dragon's Fortune is a print and play set collection game. The player who can cast the right spells and score the most points wins. Dragon's Fortune can currently be printed via artscow.

Here are links to the artscow decks. You will need to print both decks to play the game.
Deck 1: Link coming soon!
Deck 2: Link coming soon!
85557.name: Legend of the Dragon's Fortune

85558.description:
Each player has a fleet of ships which they may position both horizontally and vertically on their own playing grid. The players then take turns trying to sink their opponent's ships by firing missiles at them. The player who successfully sinks their opponent's fleet first, wins the game.

The Radio Shack SEA BATTLE game is the modern electronic successor to the well-known Sea Battle game. Two people can play against each other or one player can play against the computer. Play the Traditional Game as well as several exciting new variations such as:

Live Action Game with scoring: Quickest to the draw wins the right to fire.

Salvo Game: Each side fires 5 shots in a row.

Advanced Game: Players get to choose their fleet size.

Solo Game: Play against the computer!
85558.name: Electronic Sea Battle

85560.name: Poppin' Puzzlers
85560.description:
This is basically a two-player version of the 1970's game Perfection, in which you have a set of plastic shapes that fit into holes on the board. The board is pushed down into a spring-loaded box with a timer. When you fit all your shapes into the right holes, you turn off the timer. If you don't turn it off in time, it pops and sends all your pieces flying.

Poppin' Puzzlers is exactly like that except each player has his own set of pieces, orange or yellow, and you play on opposite sides of the game unit. There are 20 pieces for each player. The pieces get stored in a compartment on the top of the game board.

85561.name: Roll 'n Divide
85561.description: In Roll 'n Divide, players work together to form division equations and then build individual triangles with double-sided chips (one color on each side for each team) to win the game. You roll a 10-sided die to determine the quotient (answer) you need to make. The you pick a chip for the dividend number and divisor number. You can place them anywhere on the board, either to be part of a triangle you are making or to block your opponent from making a triangle. If you roll 7 for example, you can take the 56 chip and the 8 chip to place on the board. You could also take the 77 chip and 11 chip to put on the board. You are able to turn over an opponent's if you are able to use the previously used number in your new equation. The game board doubles as a storage tray for the pieces.

85562.name: LineUp
85562.description:
The Memory Crime Game with a Sneaky Selection of Suspects

This comical crime game is perfect for showing off your memory skills. Travel the game board and stop at each of six crime scenes to take a five-second eyewitness look at the suspect. Study the picture, because when you head back to the police station for a lineup, you’ll face a challenging string of look-alike suspects. Kids who can analyze, differentiate and remember the smallest details will come out ahead. But there’s a glitch in the system: a Lucky Break could trip up even the most solid ID.

85563.name: Skippity
85563.description:
If Susan McKinley Ross' Qwirkle can be described as a simplified Scrabble – with colors and shapes replacing letters – then her 2010 release from MindWare – Skippity – might be dubbed "checkers for the Timothy Leary set".

On a blazingly colored 10x10 game board, players randomly lay out one hundred tokens in five colors, then remove the tokens from the four central squares. On a turn, a player takes a single token and jumps orthogonally over an adjacent token to an empty space, capturing the token jumped. Multiple jumps are possible, with the player capturing each token jumped.

The game ends when no more jumps are possible. Players then compare their stacks of tokens, with each set of five differently-colored tokens counting as a set. The player with the most sets wins, with the tiebreaker being the number of tokens captured but not in sets.

85564.name: Pix Mix
85564.description:
In Pix Mix, players are presented with a jumble of images and they need to determine what's what – and fast.

To set up for the round, each player takes six transparent cards from the bottom of the deck of eighty cards and (without looking at them) inserts them into one of the four card holders in the game. (With two players, each player sets up two card holders.) Ideally these cards have been mixed and shuffled so that they face in different directions. Once all the holders are set, each player passes a holder left, then a 30-second sand timer is started, during which time each player writes down on their score sheet what images they think they see in the line-art jumble. Players go through this process for each holder, then they reveal the images one by one. A player scores one point for each image correctly identified.

After two complete rounds, the player with the highest score wins.

85565.description:
It's the world's first figure skating board game! Represent your country in the Figure Grand Prix. Who will be the figure skating queen in this competition? Enjoy all the thrill and excitement of figure skating with this board game!

Players control skaters from 6 different countries. There are 2 rounds of play - a short program and a long program. Each skate routine is started by a jump and ends with a spin. Players draft sets of cards to perform their routine for the most points they can.

Contents:
72 Cards
1 Game Board
5 Player Markers
5 Player Tokens
1 Starter Marker
1 Die
1 Scoring Book(30 Sheets)
1 Rule Book(in Korean, English, German, and Japanese)

Award:
Won a Prize @ 2010 Korea Boardgame Create Competition - organized by KOCCA and MCST
85565.name: Figure Grand Prix

85566.name: Spin Bingo
85566.description: This Spin Bingo game is an all-in-one organized version of the classic that keeps things somewhat tidy. An 18-inch octagonal plastic tray cradles eight sets of numbered Bingo cards, while small wells beside each hold plastic chips for covering the numbers on the cards. In the center of the tray, a spinning roulette-style wheel catches a steel ball in a lettered, numbered space when it stops--telling players what numbers to cover in their race to get five in a row. For younger players who are just learning to read double-digit numbers, it's good reinforcement; but, it's also fun for adults who usually can't sit through a "kid's" game.

85567.description:
“QUIET, please!” … The whole Stadium goes quiet. Tossing the ball and getting to the perfect trophy pose. You unleash the a breath and accelerate the raquethead and hit the ball just right. The serve radar reads 139 mph and the ball catches the service line before flying past your opponent. Ace! 15 – 40. Now if you can make just three more. It’s only the beginning, the first game, and you are already in a deep hole. No matter you. You step up to the basline and get ready to toss the ball...”

Presentation
Passing Shot is a dice game for two, that simulates a Tennis game in which each player takes a role of a Tennis Player. By means of consecutive dice rolls, the main aim of this game is trying to win points, games, sets and finally, the match.
85567.name: Passing Shot

85568.name: WWF Superstars
85568.description:
User Summary

A wrestling game based on the over the top characters from the WWF. Pick from 5 wrestlers and go for the belt. Features Hulk Hogan, The Ultimate Warrior, "Macho King" Randy Savage, "Million Dollar Man" Ted DiBiase, and Mr. Perfect.

85569.name: Troy Aikman NFL Football
85569.description:
User Summary

Troy Aikmans game was the first to come from the 1993 Dallas Cowboys team. Emmitt smith later had his own game.
Play American football in this game against the computer or your friends.
Boasted a vocabulary of less than 10 words for the referee.

85570.name: The Guild 2: Pirates of the European Seas
85570.description:
User summary:

In The Guild 2: Pirates of the European Seas you get to start out as a Patron, a Scholar, a Craftsman or a Rogue, as in the original game, but now you have the opportunity to also build three new buildings: The fishing shack-smokehouse in which you get to be a Fisherman, the pesthouse-hospital in which you get to be a Medic and the pirate nest in which you can be a Pirate.

Work your way up the social ladder and become a rich Patrician, satisfy your political or religious aspirations by becoming a Cardinal, an Earl, a Baron or even the King!

Several kinds of ships, from small fishing boats to large cogs, give you the opportunity to explore the seas in four huge new maps, get involved in exciting sea trade, fight against pirates in ferocious sea battles and conquer the seas of the Hanse!

85571.name: The Guild 2: Venice
85571.description:
User summary:

In this third stand-alone installment of The Guild 2 you get to play in 15th century Venice. You have a selection of four new maps of Venice and Trieste area to choose from, and as in the previous games you get to create your own character. You choose your gender, your class among four different professions, set up shop, hire employees and get involved in trading. A successful career will give you the chance to improve your talents, become a rich Patrician, upgrade your estate and business and prevail over your rivals.

The continuation of your family into the next generation is also vital, thus creating a family and raising children is also a central aspect of the game. In the political part of the game you will have the chance to pursue your political aspirations by buying or gaining titles such as Mayor, Baron or Earl.

85572.description:
The latest game in the tradition of Napoleon's Last Battles and Four Lost Battles will cover Napoleon's 1809 Danube Campaign. Like the other games players command the forces of Napoleon or the Coalition on a hex map covering three battles. Cards activate units and cause events to occur. The scale will be 525 yards (480 meters) per hex, 1 hour per turn, 500-800 men per strength point.

The Battles Simulated:
Abensberg, April 19-20
Eckmühl, April 21-22
Aspern-Essling, May 21-22
Wagram, July 5-6
3 maps, 2 counter sheets, 2 card decks, etc.

Abensberg and Eckmühl are each playable as single-map battle games as well as a two-map game of the double battle. Aspern-Essling and Wagram are played on the same map. Hence there are four separate battles in this package, played on a total of 3 full-sized maps. Campaign Game options link the four battles.

An Additional bonus scenario was added at the last moment as the game went into production: The Battle of Teugen-Hausen, April 19.

Part of the "The Library of Napoleonic Battles"-Series - formerly known as the Napoleon's Last Battles (NLB)-Series"
85572.name: The Last Success: Napoleon's March to Vienna, 1809

boardgameaccessory.173835: 1809 A Fatal Necessity: The companion to the Last Success

85573.name: Discover Through Play with Chicky
85573.description: This is a roll-and-move game published as an advertising premium for the KFC Chicky Club in Singapore. Players roll two dice and move their Chicky token forward that number of spaces, trying to be the first to reach the Finish (on space 100). Along the way players may land on special spaces and have to follow the instructions on the space - one of these sends the player to their room where they have to roll six before continuing. Landing on a player sends that player back to the start.

85574.name: Heads and Tails
85574.description:
This appears to be a reproduction of an older game. From the rules:
"Heads and Tails is the ideal family card game suitable for all ages. The box contains 48 cards which form 24 complete pictures and the cards can be swapped around to make 576 different pictures."

In the game for several players, the cards are dealt out completely to all players and players lay down as many complete pairs as they can make. Subsequently, players play one card to the table at a time, trying to match a head to a tail - in this phase, any head and be matched to any tail.

In the game for one player, the player stacks the heads in one deck and the tails in another and reveals one from each deck simultaneously if they match, the pair is set aside, if not, the next pair is revealed. The player goes through the deck as many times as necessary to pair off all cards.

85575.name: Pokemon Challenge
85575.description:
From the box, "The electronic head-to-head spinning top game. Which Pokemon is stronger? With the Pokemon Challenge, the electronic head-to-head spinning top game, you can find out!

Choose two Pokemon characters from the included disks and insert one into each top. Use the electronic turbo-launch system to launch them into the battle arena. Each player has two sets od flippers to keep the action moving. The last top spinning is the winner!"

85576.name: Solomon's Keep
85576.description:
Near the town of Dead Hawg, past the Grimwood, at the very peak of Mount Awful, there stands a crumbling tower of mortar and stone.

Deep within this foul edifice, the blackest necromancer of modern times, Solomon Dark, sits on his horrible throne.

In Solomon's Keep, your goal is to storm the Dark Lord's lair, unbind his minions, loot his evil possessions, and prove once and for all to your teachers that you're not as stupid as you look.

If you enjoy the play style of action RPGs like Diablo and Torchlight, you'll love Solomon's Keep!

Find treasure, destroy monsters, and improve your skills so that you can win the final battle with Solomon himself!

Source: The Game Website.

85578.name: Dog's Life

videogamehonor.32593: 2005 British Academy Game Awards Best Adventure Game of the Year Nominee

85578.description:
Dog's Life is a video game published by Sony Computer Entertainment Europe for the Sony PlayStation 2. It was released in Europe in October 2003 and in North America in 2004.

The game averaged review scores of approximately 70%, with critics praising the game for its originality and fun factor, while criticising its audiovisuals.

According to the Guinness World Records Gamer's Edition, 2009 Dog's Life holds the world record for the most video game voice-overs done by one person: Kerry Shale voiced 32 characters from the game.

Set in rural midwest US countryside, Dog's Life sees its hero embark on an epic journey that spans the US, taking in everything from ski resorts to vibrant cities along the way. Playing as the nimble-pawed protagonist Jake, a plucky pup with a nose for adventure, the player must sniff out a sinster dog-napping plot involving the canine-hating Miss Peaches and Jake's pedigree chum, Daisy.

Dog's Life allows the player to take the role of a lifelike hound, able to fetch, sniff out food, chase chickens and explore.

An American Foxhound named Jake is the main character and his overall objective is to save Daisy, a Yellow Labrador Retriever whom Jake is keen to impress, and a lot of other dogs from a crooked cat-food company CEO, Miss Peaches and her two henchmen, Wayne and Dwayne. Bones must be collected to advance through the game and they can be obtained by digging them up, by beating other dogs in a variety of challenges, by completing tasks given by human characters, and by collecting special smells.

After Jake has rescued all the other dogs, he proceeds to rescue Daisy from the deadly cat-food machinery. Miss Peaches is then knocked into the machine by Jake and Daisy is saved.

The game allows the player control or interact with over 15 breeds each with distinct traits and abilities. They handle things in a different way, that can also be used in challenges or puzzles.

The game is divided into three areas: Clarksville, a rural town; Lake Minniwahwah, a ski resort; and Boom City. These are then divided into smaller areas such as districts or farms. In every area are humans willing to give missions in exchange for bones. Bones can also be found buried underground or hiding somewhere.

Certain smells picked up through the game's "Smellovision" will activate challenges against a local dog. In each small section of the game there are four challenges, two of which are to find eight smells of the same colour and compete against a local dog. These missions include races, obedience trials, tug-of-war games and a territorial game where the player must run around urinating in marked areas to obtain territory.

There are also salons in some levels where Jake can get his coat cleaned and brushed. He also gains a shiny new collar with a silver 'J' at the front.

Once these dogs are beaten, the player is able to take control of that dog and use their special abilities to find other bones. Other challenges include scent-collecting challenges, and a minigame called "Doggy Do", where the player must copy the moves of the local dog. There are also dangers in certain areas, such as the dog catcher and his Doberman. The player must also keep the Jake healthy by feeding him, allowing it to defecate and coax people into giving the player snacks by growling and barking or performing tricks unlocked by doing the obedience trials. Jake is able to do a range of tricks including begging, sitting, lying down and marking his territory.

Jake can interact with NPC's some things include chasing chickens, steal sausages, and shake kittens.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dog's Life," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

85579.description:
From manufacturers description:

Monopoly Schwarzwald (black forest) by Winning Moves.
The regional editions of Monopoly. Who doesnt know the fascination of this game. With the regional editions one can play in different regions/cities/towns: the birthplace, the home region or a region where one always wanted to visit.

In my own words:
Monopoly Schwarzwald (black forest) is the adaptation of the famous Monopoly game unto the the black forest region in southern germany. A region with nice scenery and which is a famous tourist destination.
85579.name: Monopoly: Schwarzwald

85581.name: Rommel: Battles for North Africa
85581.description:
User Summary:

Rommel: Battles for North Africa uses the Battlefront system to depict 8 scenarios from the war in North Africa - Tebourga Gap, Syria, Alem el Halfa, Sidi Rezegh, Kasserine, Cauldron, Malta and Maknassy.

85582.name: Knowledge Arcana (Issue 4 - Winter 2005)
85582.description:
Issue 4 of Knowledge Arcana

Cover art by -Ras Pechuel

85583.name: Battles in Normandy: June-July 1944
85583.description:
User Summary:

Battles in Normandy uses the Battlefront system (with some changes) and applies it to 8 battles of the Normandy campaign - Omaha, Utah, Sword, Cherbourg, Carentan, Villers-Bocage, Goodwood and Epsom.

85584.name: The Guild 2: Renaissance
85584.description:
User summary:

In this latest stand-alone expansion you will find yourself in a situation where the world is about to move into a new revolutionary era: The Renaissance. You will witness a newlyfound, vigorous and free Middle Class striving for wealth, power as well as knowledge.

Enter this world having to make a choice among nine all-new different professions. Will you choose to be a sellsword, an innkeeper, a miner or a banker? Will you be tempted by the more traditional stonemason, miller or fruit grower? The extemporaneous juggler or the sinister grave digger may also catch your attention.

Having a family and children who will pass your heritage into future generations continues to be highly important, as is your meddling in the political and/or religious matters of your community. It goes without telling that strengthening your business(es), personal abilities and financial prosperity will take you far in all those endeavors. Furthermore, the all new feature of Town Armory for storage of weapons and armor will give you the opportunity to increase your reputation by joining battles as mercenary or officer.

New exciting maps and scenarios such as Transylvania, the Alps or the Rhineland promise you endless hours of high quality entertainment.

85585.name: Worm War I
85585.description:
From the back of the package:

Worm War I has begun. Hordes of giant worms are descending upon the city of Teriyaki! It's up to you, a master tank commander, to skilfully navigate through the ruins and blow away these destructive invaders. Be careful, Many a good driver has run out of gas and been wiggled to death under the weight of a giant worm! Lots of luck commander!

85586.name: Turmoil (1982)
85586.description:
From the back of the package:

Imagine yourself being attacked from both sides by the most evil creatures ever to fly the unfriendly skies. You are piloting an intergalactic fighter with the ability to blast seven enemies into cosmic dust at once. Now picture a battle raging at a pace so frantic that even blinking your eyes could lead to a fatal collision. If you are faster than a speeding bullet, if you can turn off the lights and be in bed before the room gets dark, then you are ready for turmoil.

85587.name: Muppet RaceMania
85587.description:
From the back of the case

Muppet Racing Madness!

Karting round the lavish sets of their six blockbuster movies, the Muppets are racing, bumping and battling their way to the finish line in a frenzied flurry of felt and fur. So get into high gear with Kermit, Fozzie and the rest of the gang and join in the action-packed adventure of Muppet RaceMania!


12 Diverse Game Modes:


Including stunt, adventure, battle and even kids mode that lets younger players push the gas while the steering takes care of itself.


25 Selectable Vehicles:


Including a Doozer Dumper, Dr. Teeth's Hotrod, the Pigs in Space ship and more!


28 Zany Tracks from Six Muppet Movies:


- The Muppet Movie
- The Great Muppet Caper
- The Muppets Take Manhattan
- The Muppet Christmas Carol
- Muppet Treasure Island
- Muppets From Space
...also includes 28 exclusive movie clips throughout!


Exclusive Music:


Muppet tunes the whole family can enjoy!

85588.name: Tigger's Honey Hunt
85588.description:
From the back of the case

It's a Tiggerific Good Time!

Winnie the Pooh needs YOU! How can he throw a party without honey? Play as Tigger and run, jump, and bounce around the 100 Acre Wood in search of Pooh's "most favorite" snack. Along the journey, they'll be plenty of challenges - blustery blowing leaves to ride, icy terrain, falling boulders, menacing bees, pesky bats and more. Earn Tigger's bonus jumps to explore special areas.


Explore 9 levels
Master 3 mini-games
Collect picture pieces for a special photo album surprise.

85589.name: Tchibum na Lagoa
85589.description:
Tchibum na Lagoa is a game publiched by Brazilian Cosmetic Company Natura to call in children to clean a garbage full pool and restore wild life to it.

It is a cooperative game to children from 4 years old. On each ones turn, the player rolls the dice and move their boats around the pond to collect recyclable trash, put the trash in recycling bins or restore wild live to the pond, which can only be done after the pond is clean. The players have 12 rounds to perform this task. The die rolling have a twist in which a player's results may be divided among two players, if the right side is up.

85590.name: Type 97 medium tank
85590.description:
"Type 97 medium tank" is 4th game of "Tank Combat series". This game represent tactical tank to tank combat in　Pacific theater. This game include 29 Japanese tanks, 10 Russian tanks, 9 US tanks and 10 anti-tank guns.

Each player control one or more tanks and battle for opponent tanks or guns by scenario order.

Each turn divided 6 Impulse. Each impulse repeat movement then fire and overrun. Game proceeds very slowly, but near simultaneous progress with not pre-plotted.

SCALE : Each unit represent one AFV or one anti-tank gun. Each turn represent 30 seconds in real time.

85591.name: SpaceMaster X-7
85591.description:
From the game's manual and the back of the package:

Centuries ago, a Hyperion military base was established halfway through the galaxy's only known express route. All ships using this route are forced to stop and pay a very high toll. The penalty for non-payment? Instant death! All attempts to destroy the base and stop this ancient injustice have met with dismal failure.

Your Assault Ship was specially designed to destroy Hyperion Military Bases. Your mission is to destroy as many of them as possible. You can fire missiles through the gaps in the Force Field or from inside the Force Field. If you are able to sneak inside, you must quickly destroy the Base before the Force Field closes in on your Assault Ship. This is no easy task! The Base can construct electrifying Shields during battle and is protected by a variety of deadly defenders. If you are able to avoid all of them, you will be truly deserving of the title Space Master X-7.

85592.description:
Norenberc: Bonus Townsmen is an expansion for Norenberc that was originally available to early adopters at Essen 2010.

It consists of eight additional townsmen, which have a red background to distinguish them from those in the base game. They are shuffled into the starting deck before any townsmen are returned to the box. The bonus townsmen are two "Bankers," two "Jack-of-all-trades," one "Historian," one "Merchant," one "Haggler," and one "Duchess."
85592.name: Norenberc: Bonus Townsmen

85593.name: Dr. Gardner's PICK-AND-TELL GAMES
85593.description:
A roll-and-move game with each space indicating one of four grab-bags containing storytelling prompts (small plastic toys, face pictures, words, and descriptive actions), additional movement, or spinner use (resulting in further movement or chip award / loss). When a child lands on a "bag" space, a prompt is drawn, and varying numbers of chips are awarded for the originality and completeness of story the child tells the therapist (a beginning, middle, and end being encouraged). The therapist may then be awarded chips for a responding story to which the child may respond for more chips.

From the publisher's description found on multiple websites listing this game for sale:

A Psychotherapeutic Game for Children

In this effective and comprehensive therapeutic game, Dr. Richard A. Gardner has combined four therapeutic storytelling techniques: The Bag of Words, The Bag of Toys, The Bag of Acts, and The Bag of Faces, incorporated in all of the important elements that have made Dr. Gardner`s games a staple of childhood therapy.

The instructions detail the effective use of this storytelling technique as a diagnostic and therapeutic tool, with many case examples.

For use by therapist plus one child.
Ages 5-12

From the directions:

"The time frame of play is not fixed; rather, the duration of play is determined by the therapist's judgement...When the play time is ended, the player with the most chips is declared the winner...The players need not reach the finish point to end the game..."

"The Pick-and-Tell Games are indicated for the wide variety of children's psychotic problems. They are contraindicated for psychotic children and/or those significantly involved in fantasy. Such children's problems might be entrenched because the games encourage further fantasizing. Such children should play reality-oriented games e.g. The Talking, Feeling, and Doing Game."

"The Pick-and-Tell Games were designed to be used only by mental health professionals in their therapeutic work with children. Accordingly, every reasonable attempt is made to limit the sale and distribution of the game to such professionals."

85594.name: Australian Realms (Issue 1 - June 1988)
85594.description:
From index:

The Dark Knights: Background for the AD&D scenario
Australia - Gamma style part I: An Australian campaign setting for Gamma World
The White Rose: An AD&D scenario
Magick Research: An alternative system for AD&D
A Cavalier Attitude: Destroying some myths
Roleplaying: What's in a name?
Experience Wanted: Another alternative system for AD&D
Reviews: A look at Star Wars & Dragonlance adventures
News
Crime File: A column for superhero gamers
Letters: Get the message
Vostok 3: A science fiction story
Monster Gallery: A collection of reader's monsters
Page of Pandemonium
Wizsearch

85595.name: Australian Realms (Issue 2 - July 1988)

rpgissuearticle.210584: AD&D - The Next Dimension: Campaign armies

85595.description:
From the index:

AD&D - The Next Dimension: Campaign armies
Atrifacts of the Elves: Assorted weapons and armour
Heaven Help Us!: The clergy in Call of Cthulhu
The Mummies Curse: An AD&D scenario
Corruption in the Priesthood: Clerics in AD&D
The Horned Society: Druids in AD&D
Previews: What Planar games is doing.
Surveys: Readers poll
Reviews
Letters
Crime File
Monster Gallery
News
The Silent Room: A short story

85596.name: Australian Realms (Issue 3 - Aug 1988)
85596.description:
From the Index:

The Master: NPC class for AD&D
Introduction to Roleplaying: For the uninformed
Blood on the Rose: The sequel to the White Rose from Issue 1
Australia - Gamma Style, part II: An Australian setting for Gamma World
The Final Measure: War Trolls for Warhammer 40,000
Space Rats: Skaven adapted for Warhammer 40,000
Mastering Rolemaster: Solving some problems
Reviews
Survey
Letters
Monster Gallery
Crime File
News
Eldritch and Invincible

85597.name: Max & the Magic Marker
85597.description:
User Summary

Max and the Magic Marker is a 2D platformer for the Wii, PC, and Mac. The player controls Max, a young boy with a marker that can bring drawings to life. At the start of the game, Max draws a monster, Mustacho, but once it animates Mustacho escapes into some other drawings and Max must chase after him to halt his rampage. Levels are combination platform-puzzles, and Max needs to advance across a series of platforms by drawing objects onto the screen that aid his passage. The marker has a limited amount of ink and occasionally Mustacho will appear to drain the pen completely. Max can run, jump, and climb through the levels, and also refill the marker by collected ink bubbles spread through the stages. Max is vulnerable to most enemies and hazards, including rain.

85598.name: Snowball Arena
85598.description:
Snowball Arena has been created during the Christmas Print And Play Game Design Contest 2010.

Snowball Arena is a tactical game, where two teams of up to 4 players each have to get the Christmas gifts into their home base.
Each round players select one card out of six to determine their possible actions this turn.
Combat is dice driven, however it is not the primary goal to get rid of the other players - since they will respawn anyway. The goal is to get the presents into the home base, before the other team gets them.

85599.name: Jett Rocket
85599.description:
User Summary

Jett Rocket is an action-adventure game for download for the Wii. The game takes place on the planet Yoroppa while it is being attacked by the evil “Power Plant Posse”. The player controls the hero Jett and has the ability to ride a number of different vehicles including a boat, snowboard, and jetpack. Jett explores Yoroppa’s various environments and takes on large bosses and collects solar panels.

85601.description:
Oak Island, Nova Scotia, 1900

In 1795, Daniel McGinnis found a 10-foot circular indentation in the ground, in the centre of a man-made clearing. A large branch (and some say the remains of a pulley) hung directly above the pit. He recruited friends and, armed with shovels, they began to dig. They found a solid floor of oak-logs every 10 feet for a considerable depth. Sea-water floodied the pit and prevented them from digging further. What still lies buried over 100 feet below the surface depends on who you ask: Captain Kidd’s treasure, Incan gold, Shakespeare’s lost manuscripts, the Holy Grail, or perhaps nothing at all.

Over the years more men brought their ingenuity to bear on the problem, but failed. The failures were due to lack of modern machinery and ignorance; each excavation being stopped by water and lack of funds. A new century brings new technology and every hope that the mystery of Oak Island will soon finally be put to rest.

Oak Island is a board game for 3-5 players attempting to get to the bottom of the mysterious treasure pit on Oak Island. The amateur treasure hunters bring their resources to bear on the problem of excavating the pit, and compete with each other to publish their findings and theories using an innovative scoring system.

Players take turns picking up a row or column of resource cards from the card display. Action cards set in the display are triggered when a player picks it up. Machinery cards in the display do not refresh until the next round. A round ends when a player picks up the Treasure Trove License card, triggering an excavation.

The Money Pit consists of consecutive tiles that are revealed as they are excavated jointly by the players. In order to excavate a tile, the symbols shown on it must be matched on resource cards invested secretly and simultaneously by the players. Each resource card has an abstract monetary value ($, $$, or $$$); the players are ranked in order of investment, with the one who invested least playing first in the next round.
