Cyber Troopers: Virtual-On Force is a Japanese 3D Mech fighting game originally released in arcades. The game has since been scheduled to be re-released on the Xbox 360. The game focuses on tactical combat between large Mechs and shares many similarities with the other games in the series, but Virtual-On Force differs in that it features four player matches in a 2 vs. 2 format. In order to maintain game balance while adding the complexity of additional fighters, the game uses a much simplified combat engine to its predecessors.

The Xbox 360 edition stays true to the base game with the same gameplay style, and includes most of the features from the arcade version. Xbox Live support is included to allow players to play online.

85792.name: Yager
85792.description:
From the back of the package:

The future is here. But despite superior technological advancements, security on Earth remains threatened.

You are Magnus Tide, pilot of one of the deadliest machines in the galaxy: the fighter ship Sagittarius. Force futuristic rivals to pay the ultimate price in a daring quest to save your world.

Take control of the ship's multiple weapons and capabilities and take off to a world of fast paced fighter pilot action, where the stakes are high and the altitude is low.

> Complex control system is easy to learn and quick to master. Switch between hover and jet modes to maneuver the Sagittarius.

> Intense aerial combat with a combination of dog fighting missions and ground attack objectives.

> 22 large scale levels! Multi-faceted terrain impacts your flight strategy. Dive into canyons and soar over mountains, but don't let the striking views distract you!

> Massive range of ships, including agile fighters to huge battleships and carriers. Outside the Sagittarius, try getting behind the controls of a gun turret to fend off an onslaught of enemies.

> Engaging story line that features constant vocal interaction with numerous characters throughout the game.

85793.name: Pure Futbol
85793.description:
"Pure Football (also known as Pure Futbol in North America) is a football video game developed by Ubisoft Vancouver and published by Ubisoft. It was announced in March 2010 with a trailer."

Source: Wikipedia, "Pure Football", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

85794.name: Pro Cycling Manager 2010
85794.description:
"Pro Cycling Manager 2010 is a cycling video game. It was released just before the 2010 Tour de France (PCM 2010 is the Tour de France licensed game)."

Source: Wikipedia, "Pro Cycling Manager 2010", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

85795.name: Prison Break: The Conspiracy
85795.description:
"Prison Break: The Conspiracy is an action-adventure video game based on the first season of the Fox television series Prison Break, released for Microsoft Windows, Xbox 360 and PlayStation 3.

It was released on March 19, 2010 in Germany, March 26, 2010 in the United Kingdom and Europe, and March 30, 2010 in North America. The game had been in development for PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360 for release in February 2009, but was canceled when Brash Entertainment closed down. However, ZootFly continued the development and self-funded the project for 13 months. Once the game was polished and nearly finished, it was picked up by new publisher Deep Silver."

Source: Wikipedia, "Prison Break: The Conspiracy", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

85796.name: Pop Island - Paperfield
85796.description:
"Pop Island - Paperfield is a Nintendo DSi video game developed by ODENIS Studio. It is the sequel to Pop Island. It costs 200 Nintendo points, and can be downloaded at the DSi Shop. Pop Island - Paperfield is a capture the flag type game. The player's objective is to bring as many flags to their base as possible in a set amount of time, while trying to stop the opposing team from bringing flags to their base. The characters of Pop Island consist of 12 different animals and vehicles, such as a lion with wheels, surfing penguin, a fish, a skateboarding elephant and many others.

Paperfield offers a bonus for those who bought the previous title, as owners of both games can unlock three new maps and four vehicles, including a helicopter and a submarine."

Source: Wikipedia, "Pop Island - Paperfield", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

85797.name: Phineas and Ferb: Ride Again
85797.description:
"Phineas and Ferb: Ride Again is an upcoming action platform video game and a sequel of the game, Phineas and Ferb. It is the second installment of the Phineas and Ferb series. It will be developed by Altron and published by Disney Interactive Studios. It was released in North America on September 14, 2010."

Source: Wikipedia, "Phineas and Ferb: Ride Again", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

85799.name: Quantum Legions: Vanguard
85799.description:
The publisher's blurb:
Quantum Legions™ is a game of science fiction ground combat — or more specifically, a series of games simulating battalion-level conflict within the universe of the Thirteen Provinces.

Innovative command and combat mechanics allow players to quickly and easily fight out any number of battles of varying sizes, keeping the focus on tactics rather than rules. Though designed as a "hex-n-counter" board game, Quantum Legions can easily be adapted as a miniatures wargame. Details on how this can be accomplished are provided in the rulebook.

Finally, like most Majestic Twelve products, Quantum Legions includes rules for creating your own units so you can add to its exciting background, simulate your favorite movies and television shows, or create your very own universe!

Quantum Legions: Wargaming on an Epic Scale.

Additional Details:
Units are represented by counters with basic information (movement, range, attack dice, etc.) Players roll 2d6 for the number of command points available at the beginning of the turn. Command points are used to remove suppression markers, activate ordered units and place orders on units to activate on future turns. Combat is bucket of dice with the target number depending on the attack order and number of dice modified by the target's terrain.

The PDF includes five 11"x17" map sections. Two map sections are used in the basic scenario. Also included are 1" unit counters and 5/8" order and suppression markers.

85800.description:
In Octopus' Garden, players take the role of Octopuses competing to create the most beautiful gardens. Attract colourful seahorses and clown fish, without losing pearl-producing oysters to the hungry sea stars!

Octopus' Garden is a tile-laying game for 2 to 4 players. Players chose which plant and animal tiles to purchase from a central market and then decide how best to arrange them in their own garden. Careful planning is required to attract seahorses and clownfish, to protect pearl-producing oysters from the sea stars, and to avoid startling delicate feather worms.

Octopus' Garden is #8 in the Valley Games Modern Line.
85800.name: Octopus' Garden

85801.name: MapleStory DS
85801.description:
User Summary

MapleStory DS is an adaptation of the online MMORPG MapleStory. The player can choose to play as either a warrior or a thief, and will become stronger as they progress. Skills are obtained through collecting books which provide attribute points, and the player gains AI allies that fight alongside them as they advance. Two additional classes (Magician and Bowman) are unlocked when the player completes the game.

85804.name: Epidemic Express
85804.description:
Epidemic Express is a lightweight solitaire dice game, where you are battling severe outbreaks of five deadly diseases. Your goal is to contain the diseases while developing cures for each. Meanwhile, worldwide panic is increasing, so you must act quickly before civilization breaks down completely.

Epidemic Express attempts to capture some of the flavor of Pandemic (an excellent cooperative game). It is *not* related to the older 2003 card game named Epidemic

You can choose to fight only real-world diseases, or you can use the optional zombie plague.

85805.description: "City Campaign" is a 2-4 players family card game to simulate the Five Cities Campaign in Taiwan this year. Players choose to play the role of campaing manager of "Blue" or "Green" side. Each player receives 5 strategy cards in each round and there are five rounds in a game. Players will receive the information of the poll preference in each turn. You need to operate the four issues in the five cities to win more voter cards in the 5th turn. Players who wins more cities on the election day wins the game.
85805.name: City Campaign

85806.name: The Sartar Companion
85806.description:
From the publisher's website :

"The Sartar Companion is the second of Moon Design’s Gloranthan HeroQuest line of book. A huge setting and scenario book that gives you the opportunity for countless hours of sandbox play in the Kingdom of Sartar setting:

Detailed descriptions of many important locations in Sartar, including Jonstown, Clearwine, Runegate, the Colymar Wilds, Old Wind Temple, and the New Lunar Temple.
More than 40 “Road” Encounters – each one forming the basis of a game session (or more).
More than 30 Special Encounters – unique events, places, or individuals that help define Sartar as a setting.
Seven complete campaign scenarios, all compatible with the Colymar Campaign from Sartar: Kingdom of Heroes.
Complete writeups of the cults of Argan Argar, Babeester Gor, Eurmal, Heler, Kolat, and Odayla
And much much more. With some 20 maps and hundreds of illustrations, Sartar Companion comes in at about 300 pages of PURE GLORANTHAN GOLD."

85808.name: Space Legends
85808.description:
User Summary

"The complete Space Experience". A compilation of three classic older titles, Wing Commander, Megatraveller 1 "The Zhodani Conspiracy" and Elite Plus.

85809.name: URBAN-OPS: the card game
85809.description:
Urban-Ops: the cardgame sees two squads of soldiers/mercenaries fighting in an urban environment (namely, an industrial city called Horizon) , using all sorts of equipment (from sniper rifles, to short barrel shotguns; from GPS to jetpacks; from assault rifles, to medical kits, and so on) to try to win the fight.

The game has a very simple mechanic: after the players have chosen their squad (made of 6 different character, picked from the character pile, each with a specific background, image and abilities), they randomly place the locations (represented by cards) in which the fight takes place.

Then draw equipment cards, and, one at time, each player can perform, during his turn, the following actions:
1. draw up to 2 arsenal/equipment cards
2. equip up to 2 arsenal cards to the characters
3. move a character from a location to another
4. activate a character to use an equipped item

Once equipped, a card is used by rolling one D10: if the player rolls higher than the activation number (written on the equipment card), the item is successfully used, and players deal with its effects; otherwise, the card has no effect, and is discarded.
As simple as that.

But to give the game morespice, locations and character abilities give die roll modifications, so, for example, if you need to roll a 5+ to successfully use a rifle, but your character sucks at using ranged weapons, your roll will have a -1 modifier, so you'll need 6+.

Modifiers will stack, so a bonus given by the character will add up to any bonuses or detractions given by locations, and vice-versa.

As if this was not enough, hidden among the arsenal cards, there are event cards, that, when drawn, make an event happen (from earthquakes, which will destroy a location, to spies, that will make one of your characters change faction; from swarm attacks, that will make characters loose their equipment, to the arrival of mercenaries that will add a new character to the opposing squad). These events are actually thought to discourage players from continually drawing arsenal cards, and to randomize things around.

85810.name: We all had names
85810.description:
user summary

We all had names is an educational roleplayinggame dealing with the Holocaust. Over a series of four tableaus, the players see the war in Europe as the backdrop of the fate of large parts of the European jewry.

85811.name: Road Runner
85811.description:
User Summary

Road Runner is an adaptation of the Atari arcade game of the same name.

Players play the Road Runner, racing along a scrolling road and trying to outrun Wile E. Coyote. There are several hazards to dodge (trucks, rockets, landmines, holes...), and the Road Runner need to eat seeds to score points and maintain her speed. The player can also trick Wile E. Coyote to run into hazards to score more points.

85812.name: Terror in Freeport  (Revised)
85812.description:
From publisher blurb:

Terror in Freeport is 46 pages of rollicking adventure, set in Chris Pramas's dynamic fantasy city. It works either as a stand-alone adventure, or as a sequel to the best-selling Death in Freeport Revised. The d20 System once again provides the framework for a story of heroism and villainy. This time the PCs learn that not all cultists lurk beneath the streets, and not all serpent people are agents of evil.

Terror in Freeport was the second part of the epic Freeport Trilogy and the beginning of a product line that currently includes 9 titles. Terror in Freeport Revised makes this classic adventure available again in PDF format, with updated stats for the 3.5 rules. Also included are sample characters, handouts, and a fully revised version of the Cultist NPC class! Plunder and peril await in Freeport, the city of adventure.

For characters level 2-5.

85813.name: Madness in Freeport (Revised)
85813.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Hour of Destiny is at hand!
The Freeport Trilogy concludes with this exciting 72-page adventure. Return to the city that started it all with Madness in Freeport. This revised edition updates the adventure to the 3.5 rules and expands it with bonus material.

The unveiling of Milton's Folly draws near, and the PCs must uncover its sinister secrets before time runs out. This time they face more than back alley toughs and mindless undead. Sealord Drac has his eyes on the PCs and they may not survive his malefic attentions.

Madness in Freeport is the action packed climax to the first d20 campaign series.

For characters level 4-6.

85814.name: Death in Freeport  (Revised)
85814.description:
From publisher blurb:

Return to the beginning of the d20 phenomena with this classic adventure! The original version of Death in Freeport was released on August 10, 2000, the very same day as the 3E PHB. Despite a very large print run, the adventure sold out within a year and has been out of print ever since. It went on to win the very first ENnie Award and the Origins Award for Best RPG Adventure. Death in Freeport Revised makes this classic adventure available again in PDF format, with updated stats for the 3.5 rules.

Death in Freeport Revised is a 32-page module from Chris Pramas, the author of the AD&D Guide to Hell and d20 System smash hit Legions of Hell. The first book for the d20 System, this adventure has been designed for 1st to 3rd level characters and is an ideal starting place for a new campaign. The player characters find themselves stranded in Freeport, a great trading city, after a deal goes sour. A seemingly simple job plunges them into the strange underside of the city, where they uncover secrets worth dying for.

Death in Freeport is the first part of the epic Freeport Trilogy and the beginning of this dynamic product line. This PDF also includes a special 4-page excerpt from Creatures of Freeport.

An adventure for 1st- to 3rd-level characters.

85815.name: FLAGGO!
85815.description:
FLAGGO! is a trivia game about different countries around the world.
From the company website:

This gripping, educational ride is full of discovery and will expand your horizons as you fly round the world.

It calls for general knowledge, strategy, memory, skill and luck, and it covers a diverse range of subjects, including geography, art, sport, music, history, science and literature. These are just some of the things that await you! Players are fully engaged throughout the game. FLAGGO! will appeal to people of all interests. It will become like a good book, and you and your family and friends will want to return to it again and again.

85816.name: A Touch of Chaos
85816.description:
From Introduction:

A Touch of Chaos is a challenging adventure designed for four PCs of 10th to 13th level.

Dark powers, covetous of the rewards an imprisoned god would grant his liberators, have commanded a succubus named Trillabeth to find the Heart of Osiris and free Apep on their behalf. To this end she has awakened Khertoosk, now an ancient mummy, and together they have stolen the gem from Arkusdard's heir and are awaiting their dark masters' instructions on how to end Apep's imprisonment. It is around this central theme of a dark god's restoration that A Touch of Chaos has been designed.

The adventure begins for the PCs five days journey north of the great desert city of Khardrist. Motivations for making this journey can be found amongst the character hooks after this synopsis or can be supplied by DMs to fit their campaigns. Regardless of the hook used, the PCs will encounter Arcanphilus, a huge adult blue dragon and the grandson of Arkusdard. On this day,Arcanphilus will present the PCs with a simple choice; retrieve the Heart of Osiris or be destroyed. Acting on information provided by the dragon, PCs will travel into the foothills of the Patar Mountains where they will discover an ancient temple of Apep, Trillabeth the succubus, Khertoosk the mummy priest, and the 3000 year old prison of the great chaos serpent.

85817.name: Blood Moon
85817.description:
user summary

The PCs are tasked by an itinerant king to help relocate his people.

85818.name: City of Shadows
85818.description:
From Adventure Notes:

City of Shadows is an introductory adventure, designed for four to six low level characters, but the GM can increase the difficulty to allow the adventures to be played by more experienced characters.

The Lizard Isle is a place filled with adventure and mystery. Although humans and other races live on the Island they are second-class citizens for the most part and life is hard for them. The people live in misery, and outside the city walls all sorts of monsters roam the lands ready to carry off the unwary traveller [sic].

85819.name: Danger on Sizlara Isle
85819.description:
From Introduction:

This module follows The Witchlord of Bargala Woods and is designed to be the second adventure in a series making up a complete campaign. With some modification however, it can be adapted to fit into any campaign.

85820.name: The Sentinel

videogamehonor.29130: 1986 Golden Joystick Best Original Game of the Year Winner

85820.description:
User Summary

The Sentinel is a 3D puzzle game created by Geoff Crammond.

The game takes place on a 3D gridded landscape featuring different elevation levels . The Sentinel is sitting on the highest point and the player's goal is to absorb it by teleporting to its square.

The player moves by creating a new body on a visible square and transferring her consciousness to it. She can also create rocks to gain altitude and get a better view of her surroundings. Creating items and bodies cost energy, which can be regained by absorbing other items on the terrain (trees, rocks, bodies...). The Sentinel rotates periodically, and if it sees the player it starts absorbing her energy, eventually killing her if she doesn't escape the Sentinel gaze in time.

The game features 10000 levels unlockable by codes. Completing a level with more energy left gives access to higher levels than completing the level with almost no energy.

After the first few levels new elements are added to the game, like Sentries (extra Sentinels) that can transform trees near the player into Meanies, a creature that can teleport the player to a random location of the board.

85821.name: Dark Shadows on the Isle of Breezes
85821.description:
From publisher blurb:

A well-deserved vacation is rudely interrupted by a group of deadly pirates. Can the heroes defeat them and still have time to enjoy the evening's sunset. Probably not, But then that's not why they got into this business in the first place is it! The Dark Shadow on the Isle of Breezes is an adventure for 4-6 characters of levels 6-8.

85822.name: Starfall: Terror in Sweetwater
85822.description:
From Introduction:

The following module is designed for a beginning level party of 4 to 6 characters between 1-3 level.

All the story's actions happen in and around the pastoral town of Sweetwater. Sweetwater is an old logging town and currently is home for approximately 130 residents. On a warm midsummer night, a meteor crashes into a hillside deep within the Terlanik forest, not a day's ride from Sweetwater.

This "fireball" or "skyrock" is, in actuality, the shell of a Creature whose origins are steeped in mystery.

85823.name: The Witchlord of Bargala Wood
85823.description: The beginning adventure of an intended campaign series, this pits the PCs against goblins being manipulated by a powerful magic user.

85824.name: Dinofroz Survivors
85824.description:
Two teams of dinosaurs battle each other. Battle occurs when two dinosaurs are next to each other. Then the players spin tops to see who wins the battle. When one side is completely eliminated the game is over.

The dinosaurs are collectable and randomly sealed in eggs.

85825.name: L'Aigle d'Or
85825.description:
User Summary

L'Aigle d'Or is an exploration game by Louis-Marie Rocques. The goal of the player is to explore a castle in Wesphalia in order to retrieve the famed Golden Eagle.

The player must fire buy supplies (torches, crowbars, healing potions or ropes), then sets out to explore the castle. It is a huge place, so drawing a map is advised. The game displays the character and the room he's in in fake 3D. There are traps to avoid, chests to open, ghosts to defeat, and specific items like keys to gather in order to complete the game. The game is entirely keyboard driven. There is a light RPG touch in that the player must manage his inventory and his hit points.

First released for Oric Atmos machines, it was later ported to several other platforms, including Thomson MO-5 and Amstrad CPC. It was a huge hit when released in France, earning the 1985 Best Adventure Game award ("Tilt d'Or") by French video game magazine Tilt.

189362.name: Panzer Grenadier: 1942 – The Defense of France

85826.description:
From the Avalanche Press website:

While the SS assault the Kursk salient from the south, German plans had the Ninth Army hurling three panzer corps against the bulge's northern flank. With weeks to prepare, the Soviet 13th Army had dug in with multiple lines of anti-tank guns, and once the Germans broke through they had to face the Second Tank Army.

Kursk - Burning Tigers is a stand-alone game in the Panzer Grenadier series. You do not need any other game in the series to play any of the 40 scenarios. Design is by Panzer Grenadier veteran Mike Perryman (Workers and Peasants among many others).

In this game the German Army wields new weapons for its long-planned offensive. Panther tanks, Ferdinand tank destroyers, Goliath explosive tanks and more are in the German arsenal. The Soviets counter with masses of the excellent T-34 medium tank, plus Lend-Lease Churchill tanks, T-70 light tanks and much more.

There are four semi-rigid mapboards, just like those found in August 1914 or 1940 - The Fall of France. Plus 517 scorchless and sootless playing pieces. And 40 scenarios.

This game and its companion, Kursk - South Flank are exactly the games for which the Panzer Grenadier series was intended. These are the ultimate tank battles that every Panzer Grenadier player will want to fight.
85826.name: Panzer Grenadier: Kursk – Burning Tigers

85827.name: Animal Mastermind Towers
85827.description: In this exciting vertical version of MASTERMIND designed for kids, players secretly stack their animals into a tower. By asking yes or no questions, they skillfully try to get inside their opponent’s mind. The game can be played at three different levels. The first player to break the code of his or her opponent wins! Your favorite animal friends like pigs and bunnies, furry monkeys and lions, and fish and crocodiles join you on this fun adventurous game. Winner of the prestigious 2010 Top Fun Tillywig Toy Award! Check out the video featuring Animal Towers on ABC News Hottest Fall Toys.

85828.name: KLOO
85828.description:
Using foreign word cards players must discover the meaning of words and place them in sentences to score points and chase each other around France or Spain on the way to the capital. The game uses sophisticated Discovery Learning Techniques to make language learning faster and a lot more fun.

With KLOO you can in fact play 16 different games. Some are quick-fire quizzes. Others are akin to classic card games like Rummy, Whist and Patience. Players immerse themselves in the game of their choice but quickly learn a second language as they play. KLOO is currently in English to French and English Spanish.

85829.name: CYD20 (3rd Edition)
85829.description:
From Introduction:

Ecosystems collapse - deadly new viruses plague humanity - offworld colonies provide a refuge to the wealthy - megacorporations handle the real power in the world - the Internet virtual reality extends across the globe and the colonies - man fuses with machine, using cybernetic implants and genetic modifications to become superhuman and achieve immortality.

This is cyberpunk, science fiction at its best and darkest. Pioneered by writers like William Gibson and Philip Dick and by cult movies like Blade Runner, the cyberpunk genre is about a dark future - a future not as far away as we would like to believe.

The CYD20 project is a giant sourcebook intending to bridge the cyberpunk genre with the d20 system, effectively allowing you to stage cyberpunk campaigns using your favorite game system. It attempts to deal with all different aspects of cyberpunk: characters, equipment, hacking and computers, cyberware and bioware, etc. No game world details are provided in CYD20: the book is a collection of rules and mechanics to be used in your own campaigns.

85830.name: The Ice Fiend & Other Tales
85830.description:
Publisher Blurb:
The Ice Fiend & Other Tales is a set of four fantastic Hellfrost mini-adventures for seasoned characters.

In The Ice Fiend our heroes are asked to hunt a savage wolf that is terrorising a local farmer’s sheep stock. Or that is what they think! What the end up hunting is a far greater horror and leads them into great peril.

If your heroes want to see battle then A Brief Encounter is for them! Hired as mercenaries, our heroes are ordered to rid the land of some persistent orc raiders.

When you are hired to escort some livestock to the local overlord for tribute it seems like an easy way to earn some money. However this is quickly forgotten as at every step along the way the heroes are attacked by a variety of opponents - in Taxation Troubles.

The Haunted Woods harbour trouble for our heroes. After pitching camp near a dark mysterious forest everything seems peaceful until one of the characters spy a strange pale white light approaching their camp. It is a Fey Knight who commands the characters to track and kill a strange creature which is causing much concern to the local inhabitants.

This adventure contains a range of Figure Flats.

Hellfrost is an epic fantasy setting for the award winning Savage Worlds roleplaying game.

85831.name: Sailing the Sea of Stars
85831.description:
From publisher blurb:

Space navies may bristle with pride in their massive warships and politicians may gloat over their power in a dozen systems, but starports control the real lifeblood of space - trade. Politics and warfare are nothing next to the power of money.
Sailing the Sea of Stars focuses on civilian and commercial equipment and includes 30 pages packed with interstellar freighters, trade goods, and the expensive toys carried by the super-rich.

The newest entry in the Sea of Stars line of campaign resources, Sailing the Sea of Stars has tools, clothing, weapons, and ships for futuristic campaigns of all types.

85832.name: Sea of Stars
85832.description:
From publisher blurb:

Since the dawn of history, Mankind has gazed at the stars with longing. Now your players can reach the stars. Sea of Stars is a complete resource for planning, designing, and expanding a futuristic d20 campaign. This 87 page book covers everything from interstellar empires to the starships in their fleets. In addition to numerous examples of weapons, equipment, and governments, Sea of Stars includes the Campaign Worksheet, a step-by-step tool for creating new technologies, societies, economies, and more. Sea of Stars contains extensive notes on how the various elements in a campaign can work together to add greater depth to your game.

85833.name: Excalibur
85833.description:
From the Publisher:

Excalibur, the most famous of all magical swords, was wielded by King Arthur. It was given to Arthur by the Lady of the Lake as a symbol of the sovereignty of the Britons, and is said to be "the finest sword that there was, which sliced through iron as through wood". A jewelled, shining sword, Excalibur was engraved with words on both sides.

Excalibur had various magical properties: it was said to blind the wielder's enemies with a bright light, and that he who wore both sword and scabbard would not bleed from his injuries.

After Arthur's death, Excalibur was returned to the Lady of the Lake.

85834.name: Ye Little Book of Heroquest Monsters
85834.description:
From the Publisher:

A selection of over forty monsters of classic fantasy monsters for that narrative roleplaying game HeroQuest. For the harried narrator in need of inspiration.

85835.name: Earthdawn Shards Collection: Volume Two
85835.description:
Publisher Blurb:

FLAMES OF AVARICE
Stumbling upon a massacre at an isolated roadside inn, the characters track down highway brigands. But their lair on the shattered shore of the Scarlet Sea contains more than meets the eye...

BLACKOUT
In the tunnels and caverns far beneath the Inner City of Hustane, the characters investigate a potential threat to the Kingdom of Throal. What they find in the darkness, however, is far more serious than anyone had expected...

BETRAYAL’S STING
A century after the kaers re-opened, the characters get a good impression of how the vile work of the Horrors affects Barsaive’s common man even today...

A TEAR FOR JASPREE
Short-sighted greed, Barsaive's most dangerous predators, instruments of a Passion's wrath: the characters encounter some unlikely allies, facing the plague of Barsaive...

WESTHRALL’S PASSAGE
The characters are taken on a journey into the depths of the Kingdom of Throal, where the Pale Ones dwell and survival is always uncertain...

Shards Collection Volume Two is a collection of five stand-alone adventures for Earthdawn Third Edition, providing challenges for Novice through Journeyman adepts. Requires use of the Earthdawn Player’s and Gamemaster’s Guides.

85836.name: Kratas Adventures
85836.description:
Publisher Blurb:

THE THIEVERY COMPETITION
Stealing the most valuable item in the city of Kratas is one thing, but protecting it from all the other thieves involved in the competition is another. Will the characters live through to the end?

DEADMAN’S CONTRACT
Hired as assassins, the characters are out to take the life of a very prominent figure to collect the blood money. Or will they turn and work for their target instead, to find out who wants him dead?

HUNTING THE IMPOSTOR
Secret societies, dark cults, Horror-worshippers - following a trail of seemingly unrelated incidents, the characters uncover an ancient secret buried deep below the city...

Kratas Adventures is a collection of three stand-alone adventures for Earthdawn Third Edition, providing challenges for Journeyman through Warden adepts. For use with the Kratas: City of Thieves sourcebook and the Earthdawn Third Edition core rulebooks.

85837.name: Last Mission
85837.description:
Last Mission is a top-down multidirectional shooter developed by Data East and distributed in world wide release for the arcades in 1986. The game was similar to Time Pilot as players had full movement control over their ship and could move it in all eight directions.

The players assume the role of an alien-humanoid space pilot who has been exiled from their home galaxy for committing an unlearned crime. The only way the player character can return is to restore their honor; the only way to do so is to invade and defeat the alien invaders who have been known to frequently attack the player character's people using a ship called the Main Fighter.

Source: Wikipedia, "Last Mission (arcade game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

85838.name: Bomb Jack II
85838.description:
User Summary

This sequel to Bomb Jack was developed for home computers. The objective of the game is the same (picking up all the items of a level while jumping off platforms and avoiding enemies), but the gameplay has changed. Instead of jumping around freely, the character jumps automatically from platform to platform, provided they are aligned properly, enemies can be pushed off the edge of platforms, and the player collects sack of gold instead of bombs.

85839.name: Elric of Melniboné Games Master's Screen
85839.description:
Publisher Blurb:

With stunning Eternal Champion artwork facing the players, and every vital table for the Games Master, the Elric of Melnibone Games Master’s Screen is the perfect complement to a well run Young Kingdoms campaign.

With all the important tables and charts, the new Elric of Melnibone Games Master’s Screen is constructed from quality heavy-weight cardstock that will stand the ravages of many years’ gaming.

85840.name: Diplomacy: The Game of International Intrigue
85840.description:
Back of the box

Product details:

Abstract:
In DIPLOMACY: GAME OF INTERNATIONAL INTRIGUE , set in pre-World War I, you must guide your selected country with all the intricacies of diplomacy through negotiations geared at giving you control of Europe. Choose to play as England, France, Germany, Italy, Russia, Turkey or Austria-Hungary. More than a dozen neutral countries add additional strategic considerations to the mix.

Full description:
The legendary board game makes its way to the PC for an all-inclusive struggle you'll never forget. Start things off by choosing your very own pre-World War I superpower, selecting from a list that includes England, France, Germany, Italy, Russia, Turkey, and Austria-Hungary. Strategy is the key to success here, and you'll quickly find yourself betraying your friends to form allegiances with former enemies. Double-crossing and smooth negotiating are the most potent weapons in this political struggle of global proportions.

Special features:
Seven countries; intense strategy; great graphics; classic gameplay; multiplayer action

85841.name: Showboat
85841.description:
For the first time ever, the world’s Top 5 Boat Racers have gathered for an intense competition, and you’re there
to cheer them on! Place your bets and let the regatta begin! You love your favourite racers and they love their fans.
The harder you cheer, the more they love you and thank you for your support!

There’s just one catch – being the SHOWBOATs they are, they actually stop to show you their appreciation! The more people cheer for racers, the more they show off, and the more they show off, the slower they go! Every time you cheer on a racer, they’ll slow down; but cheer on the leading racer, and you’ll get rewarded! Remember, it’s not just about cheering – you also have bets that you want to win! Can you use your cheers and your influence to impact the outcome of the race and go home with the most money?

85842.name: Navy Moves
85842.description:
User Summary

Navy Moves is the second game in the Moves series by Spanish editor Dinamic. This time, Special Forces soldier Derdhal McArra must find and infiltrate a nuclear submarine in order to destroy it.

Like other Dinamic releases, the game is a side scroller split in two parts, the second being unlockable with a code given upon completion of the first. The first part has the player drive a small inflatable boat in waters crawling with mines and enemies, then scuba diving in search of the entrance of the submarine. In the second part, the player battles his way through the submarine while looking for a way to destroy the ship.

85843.name: Cootie Card Game
85843.description:
A Cootie-themed deck of cards for children. There are 6 colors (suits) of 7 body parts: body, head, eyes, mouth, antennae, left legs, right legs; plus 2 "I'm the Cootie" cards. Rules are included for:
- Build A Bug: draw until one player gets all his color parts.
- You've Got Cooties: an Old-Maid game.
- Squash the Cootie Bug: like SlapJack, but trying to collect all cards.
- Catch A Cootie: like Spoons, pass cards until you get a complete Cootie of one color.

85844.name: Castlevania Puzzle: Encore of the Night
85844.description:
Source: Konami's website.

Take control of Alucard, son of Dracula, and experience Castlevania in a whole new way on the iPhone/iPod Touch with Castlevania Puzzle: Encore of the Night! Konami brings you a truly innovative Puzzle-RPG system developed exclusively for the iPhone/iPod Touch - an exciting first for the Castlevania series!

Features and Highlights:
- Play as and against characters from Symphony of the Night
- Share your achievements with friends on Facebook!
- Play songs from your own music library during battles
- Over 20 hours of game play in Story Mode
- Dozens of unique enemies to fight and over one hundred items to collect
- Over 20 honors to earn

85845.name: Silent Hill: The Escape
85845.description:
Source: The Publisher Website.

The noises... the fog... it's all coming back...
The world of Silent Hill, the series that terrified the world with over 5.3 million copies sold, has returned - this time for the iPhone/iPod Touch.
Featuring controls that make full use of the touch panel and accelerometer, and sound that puts you right in the middle of the suspense.
With only a dull, flickering flashlight to guide you, can you find the exit and escape to safety?
...Or will you be trapped forever in the labyrinth with the creatures?

85846.name: Graveyard Shift
85846.description:
Source: The Developer Website.

A physics puzzler with funny bones. Get the skeletons back into their coffins before the break of dawn using the wacky environments in this hilarious and addictive game.

85847.name: Monster Mayhem
85847.description:
Source: The Publisher Website.

Get ready for the goriest, bloodiest, hack-and-slash monster attack game you’ve ever seen. The only game where attack IS the best form of defence!

In the dark of night the monsters are lurking. For too long they have been locked behind the great iron gates of the graveyard. The monsters can’t bare it any more so they’ve started a revolution!

Frantic fingers: An intense flurry of fingers is needed to keep the monster mayhem at bay. Use multiple weapons to Attack every Monster as they pour towards their goal.

85848.name: Cut the Rope

videogamehonor.33742: 2011 Apple Design Awards Best Mobile Game of the Year Winner

85848.description:
Source: The Publisher Website.

Chillingo and developer Zeptolab present Cut the Rope, an innovative and addictive puzzle game on the App Store. The ingenious game combines physics oriented gameplay with bright and colorful visuals in deviously designed challenges. A range of obstacles and pesky enemies provide an almost infinite number of solutions to discover. Don’t forget to collect the stars and get the candy to the hilarious creature Om Nom though!

85849.name: Cipher Core Rulebook
85849.description:
From the Publisher

The Cipher Core Rulebook contains everything you need to create and play a character with a wide range of mental abilities. From Telepathy to Clairvoyance, from Psychokinesis to Biokinesis; almost any mental power imaginable is at your disposal.

Cipher uses Broken Meme's 'Vector System' with special rules to accommodate the unique world of Cipher. Characters are hunted by a government agency known as DAEMON, and fighting desperately to avoid a prophesied Doomsday, as they attempt to make sense of their origins and destiny.

85850.name: Kiloblaster
85850.description:
Kiloblaster is a top-down space shooter based on the Galaxian style of gameplay. The player faces a wave of enemies that stay on screen till defeated, shooting at the player ship and occasionally flying downwards towards the player ship in hopes to destroy it. Unlike Galaxian, Kiloblaster allows the player ship to move in all directions, rather than just left and right. It also includes power ups and allies who occasionally show up to assist the player ship.

It was created by Allen Pilgrim, and released via Epic MegaGames

Source: User Summary

85851.description:
An expansion for A la carte that introduces new gourmet desserts for avid gamers including Spice Dice, Salty Dogs or the fiery Pomitos Frititos.

This expansion contains 4 mini expansions for A la carte and the components necessary to add a fifth player.


Menus


Before the game starts each player receives 3 menus and chooses one. He doesn't let the other players know which menus he/she has. If a player successfully prepares the dishes on the menu, at the end of the game he/she receive extra victory points. Otherwise he/she gets no extra points. For some of the menus the player also needs at least one star.


New Coffee Cups


Two new coffee cups are added to the game
- Trash can: Instead of choosing a dish from the table, a player can choose a dish from the trash can and place the dish in his/her pan.
- Flavor neutralizer: The player chooses a spice (even salt) from his/her pan and removes it from the game.


Salt Dishes


There are 5 different salt dishes. The salt dishes are placed along the other dishes. The dishes are cooked as normal, only salt is needed.


Spice Mixing


This is a new spice bottle that has 5 grains of each of the 4 different spices inside (for a total of 20). There is no salt in this bottle. A player can choose this bottle to add spices to his/her dish.
85851.name: A la carte: Dessert

85852.name: The Big House
85852.description:
From the Publisher:

The prison compound sits in a section of vast empty space in Death Valley national park. The compound is on 80 acres of land and is surrounded by an electrical double wire fence with razor ribbon on top. Onlookers have described the building proper as "plain as a cake box."

The Big House is a generic prison, filled and emptied to suit your campaign needs. The Big House is a brand new facility; its opening day is the day that you insert it into your campaign world. It is up to your players to fill it. As criminals are incarcerated, fill in their names and locations on the pages provided. This will allow you to see who is sharing space with whom and also who their cells are near.

85853.name: Wu-Jen
85853.description:
From the Publisher:

The practitioners of western magic frequently believe they work an ancient art, with tools and techniques passed on from the gods themselves. What few realize is that magic evolved with societies in the far east while western culture was still scrambling together simple spells in huts made of mud and straw.

These mysterious arcanists have learned refined, complicated rites and spells that seem esoteric and strange to those not familiar with their ways. Through the manipulation of earth, fire, metal, water and wood, these wu-jen wield arcane power that rivals the strength of the greatest magical traditions in the west.

The heart of the wu-jen tradition is difficult to describe outside the context of the culture that produces it. These spellcasters hone their art through practices and small rituals that seem inconsequential to observers, but each motion and position subtly channels arcane energies through the wu-jen. Even subtle differences in wordings of casual conversations can hold significance to a wujen adept enough at his art to utilize them.

While most western arcanists believe the base elements of creation are earth, fire, air and water, a wu-jen views the list as being slightly different. Metal is considered a pure enough force to be an element, as is wood. Air, however, is
seen as a byproduct of other forces, and not considered an element.

Wu-jen come from all walks of life, but most are educated in multiple artistic fields such as calligraphy and music. While more rustic practitioners of the esoteric arts exist, they are few and far between.

85854.name: Ninja
85854.description:
From the Publisher:

Samurai may rule the open battle field, but not all battles are won in the open. Sabotage, espionage, and assassination are the tools of the ninja, and these can do far more damage than a clever flanking maneuver. Those obsessed with codes of honor often look down upon the ninja for what they perceive as shameful tactics, and many believe all ninja are ruthless mercenaries who sell their services to the highest bidder. While true of some ninja, many ninja dedicate themselves to serving a particular lord or to protecting the less fortunate.

85855.name: Brix
85855.description:
Brix is a puzzle game where the player must slide blocks horizontally in order to get 2 or more of the same symbol to touch. When 2 or more do touch, they vanish. The player must clear the playing are of blocks in order to complete the level. There are 112 levels to go through.

This game is a clone of Taito's "Puzznic"

The game was developed by Michael Riedel (Radiesel)

Source: User Summary

85856.name: Archery Contest
85856.description:
From the Publisher

Several years ago, EN Publishing released its best-ever selling d20 rulebook, Tournaments, Fairs, & Taverns. The book contained dozens of ways to include games and events found at... well, at tournaments, fairs, and taverns. From the expected martial contests such as jousting and archery, tavern games using cards or dice, to more exotic games such as The Everyman's Fireball, Squashgoblin, and magical competitions such as The Game of Forms.

Now we're bringing Tournaments, Fairs & Taverns kicking and screaming into 2010 with the first in a series of 4th Edition versions of the many things to be found in this classic book. We're kicking off with Archery Contests - a fairly basic type of competition, but one found in many home campaigns.

85857.description:
From the publisher's website:

Ultimatum delivered by the German Ambassador at Brussels von Below Saleske, to M. Davignon, Belgian Minister for Foreign Affairs:

2 August 1914

Very Confidential

Reliable information has been received by the German Government to the effect that French forces intend to march on the line of the Meuse by Givet and Namur. This information leaves no doubt as to the intention of France to march through Belgian territory against Germany...

The GUNS OF AUGUST simulates the first three months of WWI in the West, when mobility reigned and the fate of France hung in the balance. Game mechanics compensate for players’ 20/20 hindsight to encourage historically accurate play that makes “sense” in game terms while avoiding a “straight jacket” of special rules to force irrational play. Players maneuver corps and divisions through 9-mile wide hexagons in turns that span three days each. Chit pull activation, along with modest movement point allowances, generates a highly interactive game. Combat uses artillery and rifles to reveal the comparative strengths of the opposing armies. Optional rules for variable set up and fog of war counters shroud the game in uncertainty and increase replay value.

“The lamps are going out all over Europe. We shall not see them lit again in our time”, Sir Edward Grey.
85857.name: Guns of August

85858.name: Serious Sam: Next Encounter
85858.description:
User Summary

Serious Sam: Next Encounter takes place after the first two Serious Sam games.

In this one, the hero, Sam, steps into a time machine and is teleported back to ancient Rome. Mental's forces are waiting for him there when he arrives.

The weapons in this game are clones of the ones in the other games of the series, just with different names. This game is also a console exclusive for Gamecube and Playstation 2. It is was not developed by Croteam, but rather Climax. The games are identical in style and graphics, however.

85859.name: Conqueror of Century's End
85859.description:
This is man to man combat simulation game based on "Fist of the North Star", is Japanese Manga/Anime.
Each player control one character from story. Each character is shown with a metal miniature. They make the most of various Techniques corresponding to their battle styles.

A player decides Technique to use when the begining of each turn. The movement rate and battle ability of that turn depend on chosen Technique.
The movement is pre-plotted and then executed on the movement board simultaneously. The battle action is select battle chits secretly and then executed on the battle board simultaneously.
The purpose of most scenarios is to knock down a opponent character.

85860.name: Serious Sam II
85860.description:
Serious Sam II once again pits the player into the role of Sam "Serious" Stone as he battles Mental's forces.

The game has Sam retrieving 5 pieces of an ancient medallion in order to defeat Mental.

Gameplay is similar to other entries in the series. Sam uses various weapons to defeat wave after wave of enemies. The enemy waves are usually triggered when Sam picks up items along the way. For example, a item that gives Sam +1 armor may trigger some very hard enemies, making the +1 armor pick up not worth actually picking it up.

Source: User Summary

85861.name: Fist of the North Star
85861.description:
This is man to man combat card game base of "Fist of the North Star", is Japanese manga/anime.
Each player control one character from story. A battle is done by the card play in battle royal form.
Various techniques of the battle styles that it appeared with a combination of the card and the dice can be used.
The player who survived to the game end is a winner.

85862.name: G.E.N.E.R.I.C
85862.description:
G.E.N.E.R.I.C is a basic 2D platforming game where the player must collect a certain amount of coins in order to proceed. The carious pick ups are coins, which have a base value of 1; bags which have a value of 5; and gems with a value of 12. The movement is WASD style.

The player also has a gun, aimed with the mouse, which shoots out in a straight line when fired and erases anything in its path. Anything in the game that becomes even partially erased is now a stationary object and cannot be collected, nor kill the player (in instances where the object were enemies or spikes).

The game was self-developed under the name Hempuli and published under the name Reactor Products (though all work was done by one person, Hempuli).

Source: User Summary

85863.name: Hydro Thunder Hurricane
85863.description:
User Summary

Hydro Thunder Hurricane is a boat racing game released for the Xbox 360 Live Arcade. The player chooses one of nine boats and races on a number of courses in an arcade-style game. Hurricane is a sequel to the arcade game Hydro Thunder, and includes a number of features that were included in the first game. There are a number of boost powerups that can be collected on the tracks which allow the player to speed up temporarily or jump over obstacles.

After each race the player earns credits which they can use to unlock additional elements such as game modes, skins, and courses. Hurricane includes four play modes: a 16 competitor race, Ring Master, Gauntlet, and Championship. Ring Master has the player boat through a series of rings on a course, while Gauntlet replaces the opponents with an obstacle course of explosive barrels. Championship is a combination of races and modes.

85864.name: Drake's Ambition
85864.description:
This is self-published strategy level wargame based on Japanese TV animation "Aura Battler Dunbine".
This game cover war between Ciela side and Drake side in the world of Byston Well.

A player manage a treasury, and assigns it in the development of the weapon and the military operations.
A game purpose is to ruin the country of the opponent side.
The turn order of the military operations depends on a chit-pull system. The performance of the weapon and pilot's and captain's ability influence a battle greatly.

Components (Second edition)

1 rulebook
462 counters
1 map (A3 size)
5 national administration sheets
1 game administration sheet
1 reference sheet

85865.name: Wall Street Kid
85865.description:
Wall Street Kid is a video game for the Nintendo Entertainment System in which the player must prove himself worthy by taking $500,000 in seed money in order to gain a six-hundred-billion-dollar inheritance from the extremely wealthy Benedict family. Successfully investing it in the American stock market results in rewards like going shopping on the weekend and being able to acquire expensive items such as a house. The player is also encouraged to spoil his girlfriend, as all men of the Benedict family pampered their wives. If the player is unable to raise the money needed for a key item, such as a boat or the house, he is disowned by the family, in which case the game is over.

Wall Street Kid is indirectly based on a series of Japanese Famicom games. These games were individually titled as Money Game and The Money Game II: Kabutochou no Kiseki. In both games, the same goal to acquire as much money as possible remains. However, Wall Street Kid uses American dollars while Money Game uses Japanese yen.

Gameplay

Most of the game is spent in a single office in New York City, where the player makes decisions on investments and other matters.

Source: Wikipedia, "Wall Street Kid", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

85866.name: Ultimate Air Combat
85866.description:
Ultimate Air Combat (known as Aces: Iron Eagle III in Japan) is a semi-realistic combat flight simulator developed and published by Activision for the Nintendo Entertainment System. Having relatively good graphics for the console, Ultimate Air Combat differs from other similar games by having both a cockpit view and an isometric view throughout the missions.

The game seems to be set in the near future due to some of the highly advanced weapons systems but modern day planes. In Japan, the game is known as Aces: Iron Eagle III and is barely based on the film of the same name (as both involved aircraft).

Source: Wikipedia, "Ultimate Air Combat," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

85867.name: Action 52
85867.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of N/A.




Action 52 is an unlicensed multicart consisting of 52 individual and original video games, released in September 1991 for the Nintendo Entertainment System and in May 1993 for the Sega Genesis consoles by Active Enterprises (a Super Nintendo Entertainment System version was advertised in some magazines, but never released). It initially retailed for the comparatively high price of US$199 (or "less than $4 for each game"), and became notorious among gamers for the abysmal quality of its games. Many video game collectors value Action 52 for its notoriety and rarity.

The cartridge states that it contains 52 "new and original exciting games". The games cover a variety of genres, although the most common are scrolling shooters and platform games. Examples of scrolling shooters include Star Evil, G-Force, Thrusters, and Megalonia. Some of the platform games available are Ooze, Non Human, Alfred N the Fettuc, and Bubblegum Rossie.

Source: Wikipedia, "Action 52," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

85868.name: S.C.A.T.: Special Cybernetic Attack Team
85868.description:
Set in the year 2029, an army of alien invaders led by their leader Vile Malmort has planted an "Astrotube" connecting the ruins of New York City with their space station. A new team of part-human part-machine soldiers known as the Special Cybernetic Attack Team or "SCAT" has been assembled in order to combat the invasion

Source: Wikipedia, "S.C.A.T: Special Cybernetic Attack Team," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

85870.description:
This is expansion kit for Victory in the Pacific based on Japanese fictional war novel "Story of the Eight-Eight fleet".

Predominance to the battleship of the aircraft isn't proved in this imaginary world. Because of that, the main force of the Pacific war is not an aircraft carrier but a battleship. It plays except for the added battleship, and a few rules as well as the original game.
85870.name: VITP variant: Story of the Eight-Eight fleet

85872.name: Adventure Island IV
85872.description:
Takahashi Meijin no Bōken Jima IV (高橋名人の冒険島Ⅳ, "Master Takahashi's Adventure Island IV") is a 1995 platform video game released by Hudson Soft for the Family Computer. It is the fourth and final Adventure Island game released for the system. It bears the distinction of being the final official Family Computer game in Japan and was never officially released for the international market.

Unlike previous entries in the Adventure Island series, Bōken Jima IV plays less like a straight platformer and more of an action/adventure platformer, similar to the later Wonder Boy games.

Source: Wikipedia, "Takahashi Meijin no Bōken Jima IV," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

85873.name: Akira
85873.description:
Akira (アキラ) is a graphic adventure game based on the 1988 animated movie version of Katsuhiro Otomo's manga of the same title. It was released in 1988 by Taito for the Family Computer video game console exclusively in Japan. The player takes the role of Kaneda, who begins the game when his motorcycle gang is taken to police custody after the abduction of their friend Tetsuo by the military.

Source: Wikipedia, "Akira (video game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

85875.name: Touchdown Fever
85875.description:
This version featured teams that originated from cities that had NFL teams at the time (such as Seattle and Phoenix) but not the colors or the nicknames. Graphics were toned down as they were for many arcade games ported to the system. The human players could only select 5 basic plays: Long Pass, Short Pass, QB Sneak, Backs (a hand-off) or Punt/Field Goal (Field Goals could only be attempted if the line of scrimmage was within the 15 yard line). Field Goals would always go through the uprights unless blocked by the opposing team. Despite the NFL not adopting this rule until the 1994 season, A player could attempt a 2-point conversion if so desired.

Source: Wikipedia, "Touch Down Fever," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

85876.name: ROLLE|SPIL (Issue 1 - Spring 2010)
85876.description:
First issue of ROLLE|SPIL.

Cover photo by Peter Munthe-Kaas.

85877.name: Trucker
85877.description:
Ruthless game about speed and hours of fun with a 30 ton diesel.

Goal of the game:
The aim of this game is to be the first to deliver all the parcels from your warehouse to the correct addresses. The first to do so and return to his warehouse wins the game.

Gameplay:
- Each player gets shipment cards in the beginning of the game. These define the deliveries that have to be made.
- On the board there is a road network with 4 delivery points.
- Each turn, players roll the die to determine how far their truck moves on the game board. Then they move their truck, trying to deliver their goods at the correct delivery point.
- When a truck ends on a telephone, the player must take a phone card; phone cards provide additional instructions for the player.

Box contents:
- 1 game board
- 1 die
- 4 trucks
- 19 phone cards
- 22 shipment cards:
- 16 regular
- 6 express
- rules

85878.name: Knights And Berserkers And Legerdemain (2nd Ed.)
85878.description:
Adventure!

Worlds of Wonder Wealth Power

From the back of the box:

Why do you play role playing games? Probably the reason I play, to turn fantasies into an acceptable reality, and the key word is REALISM! Compare realisms. Compare KABAL to your present system and see!

85879.description:
This is expanshion kit for Romance of the Three Kingdoms.
Add 80 leader units, army units, event cards, mini map, extend and optional rules.
85879.name: Romance of the Three Kingdoms Expansion Kit

85880.name: Mystic Heroes
85880.description:
User summary:

Mystic Heroes is a fantasy action-adventure game in which you get to play the role of either one of four brave heroes: Tai, Shiga, Lani or Naja.

You are fighting against against evil ex-emperor Kang who has escaped from his prison and is trying to once again dominate the land. Kang's magical army consists of a horde of foul creature which you will have to defeat.

Increase your magical abilities by means of magical runes you find along the way. Various health and mana point power-ups will further help you even the odds in this incredible battle against evil.

85881.name: Blackstone Barony
85881.description:
Publisher Blurb:
For 15 years Regent Orol Drakestaff has held Blackstone Barony in his iron grip, slowly squeezing the life from its people. Oppression, tyranny, and misery have wracked the land, but a new dawn is close to breaking. Baron Pendel, the rightful heir, is coming of age, and there are those who act against the Regent, albeit from the shadows. Blackstone stands at a crossroads, but whether it will walk into salvation or damnation remains to be seen. This supplement expands on material in the Hellfrost Gazetteer.

85882.name: Nooks
85882.description:
Nooks is two-player abstract strategy game of area enclosure. The standard game is played on a regular hexagonal game board, divided into hexagons with 8 hexagons to a side. Players take turns placing walls in an attempt to enclosure small areas called nooks.

A wall is created by placing four stones on four empty cells that are aligned and connected, forming what is equivalent to a straight tetromino.

A nook is an enclosed area which can not contain a wall. An area can be enclosed by wall stones and/or the edge of the board.

Players get to place scoring stones in each cell of each nook created during their turn. The game ends when the game board is completely filled and the player with the most scoring stones on the board wins the game. Ties are not possible.

85883.name: Blades of the Buccaneers: The Weapons of Captain Red Jack Roberts
85883.description:
From publisher blurb:

The weather-beaten well-tanned old man with a bushy white beard wearing a well worn oil skin and leaning against the shop’s wall takes the charred and beaten old wooden pipe from his mouth and, knocking it out on his palm, clears his throat and startles the children. “Well, lads, I would bet you that that there be the handy work of the infamous pair of Captain Red Jack Roberts and his partner Ezekiel Drake.” Bending down and pulling a worn leather journal and quill from a gunny sack, he says, “I guess that’s my cue. If you lads would excuse me I have to go talk to those survivors.” With that, the old man picked up the gunny sack and set off toward the crowd that had gathered around the damaged ship.

Blades of the Buccaneers: The Weapons of Captain Red Jack Roberts is the first book in a collection of books written by Old Pete, a scholar and sailor that has been dubbed “The Voice of the Sea.” This product tells the story of the charismatic Red Jack Roberts and his companion, the skillful Ezekiel Drake through the blades that pass through their hands. This book contains 16 weapons with a unique feel, detailed description and a history that both tells the story of the weapon and its wielders. Most of the weapons in this product have a nautical or gadget-like feel to them. The book also contains detailed rules for weapon entrapping and breaking and six feats that enhance these rules.

85884.name: Action Types
85884.description:
From publisher blurb:

Player: As a swift action I cast my Quickened Fireball and then cast Lightning Bolt as a standard action.

GM: You can do that? I think I need to look that up. (Flips through books…)

Many players and game masters alike are familiar with the above scene. A player uses an action type you have never heard of or you player uses a unusual action like lighting a torch and the game stops as you look up the action and to see if it’s legal or whether it’s a standard action or a full round action. Well, your friends here at Healing Fireball Publications have an elegant answer to this problem. The Combat Cards: Action Types present all of the various action types you can make in a round with a detailed description of each action type and a list of the specific actions that fit in each type on an easy to print and use reference card. Never search a book for the action type again - Move Actions, Standard Actions, Free Actions – they’re all here. The Combat Cards put the rules at your fingertips.

85885.name: Special Tactics
85885.description:
From publisher blurb:

Player: I sunder the barbarian's axe, disarming him.

GM: Alright, just give me a moment as I look this up. (Flips through the book for several minutes.)

Player: Nevermind, I’ll just stab him.

This is a scene familiar to any Game Master. Your players choose to take a non-standard action and the game grinds to a halt as you look up the rules. Players get bored waiting, the mood drifts away, and random conversation and jokes ensue. Well, have no fear, Healing Fireball Publications has your answer. The Combat Cards: Special Tactics are a collection of easy to print and use reference cards that cover all the most common non-standard actions. From Aiding Another to Disarming to Charging – they're all here. We even provide two large double-sided cards that cover the intricacies of Mounted Combat and the dreaded Grappling. Never search for a rule again with Combat Cards - the rules are at your fingertips.

85886.name: Braziers
85886.description:
From publisher blurb:

A faded wooden sign that simply reads “Warm Hearts” hangs from the front porch of the lonely one-floor longhouse, built on stilts to keep it off the snow pack. This simple shop is an essential stop for anyone who plans to live in the cold parts of the world, for this shop sells the best heating system available - the brazier.

Tired of rewarding players with the same old magic weapons and armor? Looking for a new set piece around which to center an adventure? Planning to run a campaign in a cold climate? Well, Healing Fireball Publications is proud to present the first book in a line dedicated to expanding underutilized groups of magic items.

This book describes and expands on the use of braziers, both as mundane sources of heat and as a base for magic items. The book also contains dynamic rules for lighting and using a brazier in all sorts of conditions. In addition to all the information on braziers, there is a complete section on different fuels to use in them and all this information is wrapped up in a fully described set piece The Warm Heart Brazier Shop, complete with staff.

85887.name: The Infamous Mischievous Renaldo Maliauctor
85887.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Sages must be crazy (or at least a little unhinged)!

Tucked down an alleyway, just out of the sight of the bustling marketplace, you find a shop marked with a cheery sign reading The Prankster’s Lair. Inside, the cluttered shop seems jammed full of all variety of strange and unusual devices. As you make your way to the back, pouches of sneezing powder, dribble glasses and a myriad of other, even stranger things, catch your eye. When you finally reach the shop’s back counter, you see a rather portly gnome dressed in the robes of a wizard, busily scribbling on a sheet of paper. As you approach the counter, the man looks up and, with a broad smile, greets you, “Welcome, my good man. I am sure we have just what you need to put a smile on your face.”

The Sages Must Be Crazy: The Infamous Mischievous Renaldo Maliauctor explores the lighter, more mischievous side of magic with a collection of spells and items inspired by classic slapstick or pranks. All of these items and spells are conveniently available at The Prankster’s Lair, an easy to drop-in-your-setting novelty store complete with a quirky and unique owner. If you’re looking for a bit of fun for your next game, or just want to flesh out that trickster character, this is the book for you.

85888.name: Ancient Battlefield Encounters
85888.description:
From publisher blurb:

Brutal battles scar the land in a way that even time cannot fully heal. Every map has them - locations where large, usually pivotal, battles occurred. Sometimes these areas are marked by the presence of a memorial but more often they are places that have been abandoned, avoided by men and home only to the scars and artifacts of battle.

But what do these places look like, what can be found there and what kind of beasts call them home? Wonder no more – your friends hear at Healing Fireball Publications have the answer with our latest product, Two Bit Tables: Ancient Battlefield Encounters. This collection of tables is designed to allow a game master to generate a collection of random encounters and landmarks that will give these places a feel of their own. As an added bonus, rules are given to use these tables to generate the aftermath and horrors of a recently-fought battle.

85889.name: Historic Battle Name Generator
85889.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ever need the name of a famous battle for your sages to refer to? Ever want to know the famous battle at which the artifact your party's been hunting was lost or have a musician who wants to sing odes about famous fights?

Look no further. Your friends here at Healing Fireball Publications have your answer with our Two Bit Tables: Historic Battle Name Generator. This collection of three tables is designed to allow the quick and easy generation of the names of historically significant battles and the famous maneuvers that occurred there. So spice up your world’s history with references to the ”Assault on Bloody Cove” and “Captain Doyle’s Desperate Crossing” today.

85890.name: Languages New and Old
85890.description:
From publisher blurb:

At last I have found the missing journal of Andarus Randaval. Now does anyone know ancient Greek?

Every game master needs a foreign language sometimes. Whether it’s to give a foreign NPC a little flavor, the language the lost journal of Doctor Maniacal was written in or the ancient carvings on the cave wall, foreign languages can spice up a game and give the world a more dynamic, living feel. But what language to use? Well never fear, your friends here at Healing Fireball Publications have your answer with Two Bit Tables: Languages New and Old. Within this product is a collection of tables for all your random language generation needs.

85891.name: Mundane Forest Animal Encounters
85891.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ever want to make your forest a more vibrant living place? Wonder what's missing?

We here at Healing Fireball Publications suspect it might be a lack of fauna. Forests are living ecosystems full of life. Two Bit Tables: Mundane Forest Animal Encounters is a large table containing 100 random encounters with animals suitable for any temperate forest. From the insects in the air to the birds in the trees, this table will breathe life into your forest with mundane flavor encounters to surprise your players.

85892.name: Potions with a Unique Flavor
85892.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the chest you find a bag of 100 gold coins, a small onyx statue and three healing potions.

Potions - an essential supply to most adventurers and a common treasure for game masters to award. But all too often they are just handed out as if they are mundane treasure like coins or jewelry. But as some of the most common magical loot in fantasy games they should be viewed with more interest as other magic items are. But how does a game master instill this interest back into potions? Well, your friends here at Healing Fireball Publications have the answer with our latest product Two Bit Tables: Potions with a Unique Flavor. This collection of tables allows a game master to generate unique looks for his potions as well as unique bottles to store them in.

85893.name: Secret Societies and Organizations
85893.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need an organization to be your party’s arch-nemesis? Need a secret group to recruit your players? Need an organization to hire your characters to save the world?

Of course you do, you’re a game master, and as long as there are stories to be told there will be a need for secret societies and organizations. But have no fear, as your friends at Healing Fireball Publications are here for you with our latest product - Two Bit Tables: Secret Societies and Organizations. This collection of four tables allows you to generate a large number of secret societies and organizations as well as the names these organizations give their members and the names of their lairs or lodges.

85894.name: Ship Names for the Whole Fleet
85894.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every good ship needs a strong name, in fact, it’s bad luck to sail a ship that doesn’t have a name or to rename a ship that has already sailed. Besides, what is the party’s lookout going to yell when their arch nemesis comes into view - “Bad ship off the port side?”

For this reason and because giving names to your world’s ships makes it feel more like a living world, your friends here at Healing Fireball Publications have created a group of tables suitable for naming all the ships in your world. From the darkest pirate vessel to the traders just trying to make a living to the stout military vessels defending their borders, you will find a name to suit all your needs. This collection of three tables contains 50 ship names designed for use with either pirate ships, merchant vessels or military ships. This product also contains a short list of common ship prefixes, such as SS, LB and HMS as well as their meanings, to put in front of the generated name to give it a more seaworthy feel.

85895.name: Trees for All Your Needs
85895.description:
From publisher blurb:

Have you ever needed to know what the tree the druids were worshipping was? Ever wonder what the forest your party is in consisted of? Ever have a party forage for food?

Then Healing Fireball Publications is here for you with our Two Bit Tables: Trees for All Your Needs. Whether broadleaf, evergreen, mixed, or tropical, there is a table here for all your forest needs. With a total of five tables, including the large 100 temperate trees table for mixed forests and the 20 fruit trees table for when your party forages for dinner, there is something here that every game master will use.

85896.name: Bane of the Salt Fen Lich
85896.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bane of the Salt Fen Lich is an adventure module for 5-8 characters of levels 5-7; this 63 page pdf includes all the extras you'd expect to find in a print module, including: new monsters, new magic items, extensive maps, pregenerated character tabletop cutout portraits,over a dozen players' aids illustrations (click), and an appendix for quickly converting the module into an Epic Level adventure while designed for the upcoming Azieran campaign setting, this product can be easily modified and played on any game world

boardgamehonor.13899: 2011 Golden Geek Best Board Game Expansion Nominee

85897.description:
Thunderstone: Dragonspire is a fantasy deck-building game much in the style of Dominion. Before the game starts a selection of Village and Hero cards will be randomly chosen that players may add to their specific decks. Like Dominion, every player starts with a basic deck of weaker cards that they can use to purchase other more powerful cards. In Thunderstone these cards may be different Heroes such as mages, archers, thieves, or warriors; or they may be supplies the heroes need like weapons, rations, or light to reach further into the dungeon.

A dungeon deck is also created by combining several different groups of monsters together. Certain groups of monsters may be more or less susceptible to different Hero types so players must take this into account when they choose what to buy.

Rather than buying puny Victory Points, players will use their deck to defeat monsters in the dungeon. From the monster deck a row of cards is laid out. On their turn, players may choose to visit either the dungeon or the village. Plays can purchase other cards for their deck or level up their heroes in the village. If they instead go to the dungeon, they play their heroes, weapons, items, and spells to defeat any one of the available monsters. The deeper the monster is in the dungeon, the more light is needed or the monster will gain power. Some monsters also have special abilities which may hinder the player. If they have enough strength they defeat the monster and place that card in their deck. This card is worth victory points and often can be used as money to purchase other cards. In addition to this players are awarded experience points for defeating monsters which can be used to upgrade their heroes into more powerful versions. The game is played until the Thunderstone is revealed from the dungeon and a player is able to claim it. The player with the most victory points in their deck is the winner.

From the publisher:

Thunderstone returns with Dragonspire! Featuring all-new art for every card (even Militia and Daggers), experience point tokens (not cards!), and the all new "Setting" cards which alter the game on a global scale. Dragonspire includes 18 new village cards, 11 new heroes, and 8 new monster sets.

With enough cards to play the game right out of the box, this is a great Thunderstone edition for those just getting into the game.

Dragonspire also has a new storage box format, plastic XP tokens, and a brand new Dungeon board to help players keep up with light and darkness.

Thunderstone: Dragonspire is not a an expansion, but is instead a separate stand-alone game that may be played along with components of Thunderstone.

NOTE: The Dragon-Humanoid divider included with the game is meant for a future expansion as a promo.
85897.name: Thunderstone: Dragonspire

85899.description:
Sphactérie (-425) is a two-player wargame on land and naval battles of Pylos and Sphacteria, during the first phase of the Peloponnesian War.

One player is in charge of the Athenians and their Messenian allies, the other one leads the Spartans and their helots. Each player has 4 commanders to lead his units. Both players receive historical reinforcements and can also try to obtain additional troops.

To achieve victory, a player has to control the fortress of Pylos and the island of Sphacteria using his fleet and his land units, while taking care of his supply.

The A4 map is divided into 27 areas (land or sea).
The game includes a sheet of 67 counters. Each strength point represents 1 trireme, 25 hoplites, 50 peltasts or 100 archers. The game also features a number of "stratagem" chits.

Note: The rules are common to Syracuse (415/413 av. J.-C.) and Amphipolis: 424/422 av. J.-C..
85899.name: Sphactérie: 425 av. J.-C.

85900.name: Free Lands of Moongoth
